TITLE I
General provisions
Article 1.- The freedom to express opinion and the freedom to inform, without prior censorship, constitute a fundamental right of all persons. Its exercise includes not being persecuted or discriminated against because of one’s own opinions, to seek and receive information, and to disseminate it by any means, without prejudice to being held accountable for crimes and abuses that are committed, in accordance with the law.

It also includes the right of every natural or juridical person to found, edit, establish, operate and maintain means of social communication, without other conditions than those indicated by law.

Persons are recognized the right to be informed about matters of general interest.

Article 2.- For all legal purposes, social communication media are those capable of transmitting, divulging, spreading or propagating, on a stable and periodic basis, texts, sounds or images intended for the public, regardless of the medium or instrument used.

A newspaper shall be understood to be any periodical that is published at least four days each week and that complies with the other requirements established by law.

Article 3.- Pluralism in the information system shall favor the expression of the social, cultural, political and regional diversity of the country. For this purpose, the freedom to found, edit, establish, operate and maintain means of social communication shall be ensured.

Article 4.- The funds established in the budgets of the State, of its agencies and companies and of the municipalities, destined for notices, calls for bids, proposals and publicity, which have a clear regional, provincial or communal identification, shall be allocated mainly and preferably to carry out the corresponding publication or dissemination in regional, provincial or communal social communication media.

Annually the Public Sector Budget Law shall contemplate the necessary resources to finance the production, editing and dissemination of programs or supplements of a regional character. The allocation of these resources shall be made by the respective Regional Councils, following a public competition. The competitions shall be decided by commissions whose composition, generation and powers shall be determined by regulation. That regulation shall also establish the procedures and selection criteria.

The Public Sector Budget Law shall annually contemplate resources for carrying out studies on pluralism in the national information system, which shall be allocated by public competition by the National Commission for Scientific and Technological Research.

TITLE II
On the practice of Journalism
Article 5.- Journalists are those who hold the respective university degree, validly recognized in Chile, and those whom the law recognizes as such.

Article 6.- Students of journalism schools, while they carry out the professional practices required by such institutions, and graduates of the same, up to twenty-four months after the date of their graduation, shall have the rights and shall be subject to the responsibilities that this law provides for journalists.

Article 7.- Directors, editors of social communication media, the persons referred to in Articles 5 and 6 and foreign correspondents who carry out their activity in the country shall have the right to keep confidential their information source, which shall extend to the elements in their possession that allow its identification, and they may not be compelled to disclose it, not even judicially.

The provision in the preceding paragraph shall also apply to persons who, by their office or informational activity, necessarily had to be present at the moment the information was received.

Anyone who makes use of the right enshrined in the first paragraph shall be personally responsible for the crimes that he or she may commit by the information disseminated.

Article 8.- The social communication medium that disseminates informational material identifying it as authored by a particular journalist or person, with his or her name, face or voice, may not introduce substantial alterations without that person’s consent; it shall be responsible for such alterations and, at the affected party’s request, shall make the corresponding clarification. This right of the affected party shall lapse if not exercised within the six days following.

The journalist or person exercising journalistic activity may not be compelled to act in contravention of the ethical norms generally accepted for the exercise of his or her profession.

The infringement of the provisions of the preceding paragraphs, when the affected party is a journalist hired or hired to perform journalistic functions by the respective social communication medium, shall constitute a serious breach by the employer of the obligations imposed by the employment contract.

TITLE III
On operational formalities of social communication media
Article 9.- In cases in which the law allows the owner of a social communication medium to be a natural person, that person must have domicile in the country and not have been convicted of a crime deserving an afflictive penalty. In the case of juridical persons, they must have domicile in Chile and be constituted in the country or have an agency authorized to operate in national territory. Their president and their administrators or legal representatives must be Chilean and must not have been convicted of a crime deserving an afflictive penalty.

Conviction to the penalty indicated shall immediately cause the affected person to cease in any function or activity related to the direction, administration or representation in the social communication medium in which he or she performs it.

Every social communication medium must provide reliable information about its owners, direct or indirect controllers, lessees, bailee-by-loan or concessionaires, as the case may be. If they are one or more persons, such information shall include that which is conducive to the identification of the natural and juridical persons who have participation in ownership or have its use in any capacity. It shall also include copies of the documents that prove the constitution and bylaws of the juridical persons that are partners or shareholders, except in the cases of publicly held corporations, as well as the modifications thereof, as appropriate. Such information shall be of free public access and shall be kept permanently updated and available at the domicile of the respective social communication medium and to the authorities that require it in the exercise of their competencies.

Concessions for free-to-air sound broadcasting requested by juridical persons with foreign capital participation exceeding ten percent may only be granted if it is previously proven that in their country of origin similar rights and obligations are granted to Chileans, in terms similar to those that those applicants will enjoy in Chile.

The same requirement shall be fulfilled to acquire an already existing concession. Failure to comply with this condition shall mean the automatic expiration of the concession.

Article 10.- Social communication media shall have a responsible director and, at least, one person to replace him or her.

The director and those who replace him or her shall be Chilean, have domicile and residence in the country, have no immunity, be in full exercise of their civil and political rights, not have been convicted of a crime deserving an afflictive penalty and, in the last two years, not have been convicted as perpetrators of repeated crimes or as recidivists in crimes punished by this law. Conviction to an afflictive penalty shall immediately cause the affected person to cease in any function or activity related to the administration of the medium.

To hold the positions of head of the press or journalist, when required by the respective staff, in any organ of the centralized or decentralized administration of the State, or in any of its companies, it shall be required to hold the journalist degree, in accordance with the preceding paragraph.

Chilean nationality shall not be required if the social communication medium uses a language other than Spanish.

Article 11.- Social communication media may begin their activities once they have complied with the requirements of the preceding articles.

Without prejudice to the norms of this law, the granting of concessions or permits for free-to-air sound or television broadcasting services or limited television services, their exercise and initiation of activities shall be governed by the respective laws.

The initiation of activities of written social communication media shall be reported to the Provincial Governor or Regional Intendent corresponding to the domicile of the medium by means of a presentation, of which said Provincial Governor or Regional Intendent shall send a copy to the Director of the National Library. The presentation shall contain the following statements:

a) The name of the daily, magazine or periodic publication, indicating the periods that will elapse between one issue and another;

b) The full name, profession, domicile and the documents that prove the identity of the owner, if a natural person, or of the persons who have the legal representation of the company, if it is a juridical person;

c) The full name, domicile and the documents that prove the identity of the director and of the person or persons who shall replace him or her, indicating the order of precedence in which they must assume replacement;

d) The location of its main offices; and

e) In the case of a juridical person, the documents containing its partners or shareholders and the percentage, amount and modalities of their participation in the ownership or in the capital of the company or, where appropriate, the documents opening the agency, its bylaws and the mandates of its legal representatives.

Likewise, any change that occurs in the aforementioned mentions shall be communicated in the same manner, within fifteen days thereafter, or within sixty days if it affects any of those stated in letter e). However, changes in shareholders or in the participation in the capital shall not need to be reported when the owner of the social communication medium is an open corporation.

The Director of the National Library shall keep an updated register of the written social communication media existing in the country, indicating the background stated in this article.

The preceding provisions shall not apply to publications that are distributed internally in public or private institutions.

Article 12.- On the first page or on the editorial page or on the last page, and always in a prominent place of every daily, magazine or periodic writing, and at the beginning and at the end of daily transmissions of every free-to-air sound or television broadcasting service or limited television service, the name and domicile of the owner or concessionaire, as the case may be, or of the legal representative, if it is a juridical person, shall be indicated. The same mentions shall be made regarding the responsible director.

Article 13.- Every printed matter, sound recording or audiovisual or electronic production made in the country and destined for commercialization shall include the name of the person responsible or establishment that executed the printing or production, as well as the corresponding place and date, without prejudice to complying, where applicable, with the other requirements set by law. In the case of books, the number of copies shall be placed in a visible place.

Article 14.- The persons or establishments referred to in the previous article shall send to the National Library, at the time of their publication, the number of five copies of every printed matter, whatever its nature.

In the case of periodical publications, the Director of the National Library shall be empowered to subscribe agreements with the persons responsible for such media to establish modalities of mixed legal deposit, reducing the number of paper copies, substituting the rest by reproductions thereof in microfilms and/or electronic media.

In the case of publications printed in regions, of the five copies, two of these shall be deposited in the public library of the region designated by the Director of the National Library.

The National Library may reject and demand a new copy if any of the deposited copies, in any medium, exhibits deficiencies or some deterioration that prevents its consultation or conservation.

In the case of sound recordings or audiovisual or electronic productions destined for commercialization, such persons or establishments shall deposit two copies of each one.

The obligation established in this article must be fulfilled within a maximum term of thirty days.

In the case of cinematographic creations, the obligation shall be understood as fulfilled when a copy in original format and one in digital format are deposited in the National Film Archive and another, also in digital format, in the National Library.

The obligation established in this article shall be fulfilled within a maximum term of ninety days. In case of noncompliance with the provisions of the first and third paragraphs, together with the corresponding complaint, the delivery of the copies may be demanded from the natural or juridical person responsible for the editorial production of the same, within sixty days counted from the expiration of the aforementioned term.

State organisms may not acquire printed works, sound recordings or electronic or audiovisual, filmic or cinematographic productions from editors, producers or creators who do not comply with the obligation established in this article, nor grant financing to them through funds or subsidies. For these purposes, the National Library shall certify that it has not made complaints relating to this infringement.

Article 15.- Free-to-air sound or television broadcasting services and limited television services, with respect to their programs of national origin, shall be obliged to leave a copy or magnetic tape and to preserve it for twenty days, of every news item, interview, talk, commentary, conference, lecture, editorial, speech or debate that has been transmitted.

TITLE IV
On the right of clarification and rectification
Article 16.- Any natural or juridical person offended or unjustly alluded to by any social communication medium has the right to have his or her clarification or rectification freely disseminated, under the conditions established in the following articles, by the social communication medium in which such information was broadcast.

Article 17.- The offended or unjustly alluded to by a free-to-air sound or television broadcasting service or a limited television service shall have the right, paying only the cost of the material used in the reproduction or providing the material that will be used for it, to require directly the delivery of a faithful copy of the transmission referred to in Article 15, which shall be made available to him or her within the fifth day. In the event that the respective service does not deliver the copy within the term or unjustifiably refuses to do so, and a judge with criminal jurisdiction deems it pertinent to establish a possible criminal event, at the request of the interested party and at his or her expense the copy may be requested to be sent to make it available to him or her. The responsible director or whomever replaces him or her shall deliver to the court the faithful copy of the transmission within the third day, counted from the notification of the resolution ordering its sending.

Article 18.- The obligation of the social communication medium to disseminate the clarification or the rectification free of charge shall apply even when the information that motivates it comes from an insertion. In this case, the medium may charge the cost incurred for the clarification or rectification to the person who ordered the insertion.

Clarifications and rectifications must in any case be limited to the object of the information that motivates them and may not have an extension greater than one thousand words or, in the case of free-to-air sound or television broadcasting services or limited television services, two minutes.

This request shall be addressed to its director, or to the person who must replace him or her, within the term of twenty days counted from the date of the edition or broadcast that motivates it.

Notaries and judicial receivers shall be obliged to notify the request upon simple request by the interested party.

Notification shall be made by means of a notice that shall contain in full the text of the clarification or rectification, which shall be delivered to the director or to the person who legally replaces him or her, at the legally constituted domicile.

Article 19.- The clarification or rectification writing shall be published in full, without intercalations, on the same page, with characteristics similar to the information that caused it or, failing that, in a prominent place of the same section.

In the case of free-to-air sound or television broadcasting services or limited television services, the clarification or rectification shall be broadcast in the same time slot and with characteristics similar to the transmission that motivated it.

The dissemination intended to rectify or clarify shall be made, at the latest, in the first edition or transmission that meets the indicated characteristics and that is made after the twenty-four hours following the delivery of the originals that contain it. If it is a publication that does not appear every day, the clarification or rectification must be delivered with at least seventy-two hours’ notice.

The director of the social communication medium may not refuse to disseminate the clarification or rectification, except that it does not comply with the requirements of the second paragraph of Article 18, or implies the commission of a crime. His refusal shall be presumed if the clarification or rectification is not disseminated at the time indicated in the preceding paragraph, or if it is not published or disseminated in the terms established in the first or second paragraphs, as appropriate.

If the medium makes new comments on the clarification or rectification, the affected party shall have the right of reply according to the previous rules. In any case, the comments must be made in such a way that they are clearly distinguished from the clarification or rectification.

Article 20.- The right referred to in this Title shall prescribe within the term of twenty days, counted from the date of the broadcast. It may only be exercised by the offended or unjustly alluded to person, or by his or her attorney or agent, or, in the event of death or absence of that person, by his or her spouse or by his or her relatives by consanguinity or by affinity up to the second degree inclusive.

Article 21.- The right of clarification or rectification may not be exercised with respect to personal appreciations made in specialized commentaries of political, literary, historical, artistic, scientific, technical and sports criticism, without prejudice to the sanction that such articles may give rise to, if by means of their dissemination some of the crimes punished in this law are committed.

TITLE V
On infractions, crimes, liability and procedure
Paragraph 1
Of the infractions to Title III
Article 22.- Infractions to Title III shall be sanctioned with a fine of two to thirty monthly tax units. In addition, in its sentence, the court shall fix a period for the accused to fully comply with the breached rule, if appropriate.

Once the sentence is final, the court shall apply a new fine for each publication appearing or transmission carried out without compliance with the respective obligation. In the case of infractions to Articles 9, first paragraph, 10 and 11, the court shall also order the suspension of the social communication medium while the noncompliance subsists.

The director and the owner or concessionaire of the social communication medium shall be jointly and severally liable for the payment of the fines.

Article 23.- The knowledge and resolution of complaints for these infractions shall correspond to the civil court of letters of the domicile of the social communication medium.

These infractions may be denounced by any person and, in particular, by the Provincial Governor or the Regional Intendant or the Director of the National Library, in the case of Article 11.

Article 24.- The procedure shall be subject to the following rules:

a) The complaint shall clearly indicate the infraction committed, the facts that configure it and attach the means of proof that prove them, where appropriate.

b) The court shall order that it be notified in accordance with the final paragraph of Article 18. The sentence that is issued shall be notified in the same manner.

c) The accused shall present his or her defenses within the fifth business day and attach the means of proof that prove the facts on which they are based. If they do not have them, they shall state this circumstance and the court shall fix a hearing within the fifth business day in order to receive the evidence offered and not attached.

d) The final sentence shall be issued within the third day after the expiration of the term referred to in the previous letter, whether or not the accused presented defenses. If the court ordered an evidentiary hearing, this term shall run once the period set for it has expired.

e) The resolutions shall be issued in only instance and shall be notified by the daily bulletin.

f) The final sentence shall be appealable in both effects. The appeal shall be filed within the fatal term of five days, counted from the notification of the party filing it, shall contain the grounds of fact and law on which it is based and the concrete requests made.

Once the appeal is filed, the court shall immediately forward the records to the Court of Appeals. This court shall resolve in chamber, without waiting for the appearance of any of the parties, within the six business days following the date of entry of the file to the court’s registry.
Article 25.- Actions to pursue infractions to Title III shall prescribe within the term of one year counted from their commission.

Paragraph 2
Of infractions to Title IV
Article 26.- The knowledge and resolution of complaints or criminal accusations for infractions to Title IV shall correspond to the court with criminal jurisdiction of the domicile of the social communication medium.

Article 27.- The procedure shall be subject to the rules established in Article 24, with the following modifications:

a) The term to present defenses shall be three business days; and

b) There shall be no special term for evidence.

Article 28.- The court, in the resolution that orders the publication or broadcast of the clarification or rectification, or its correction, shall fix a term for it and may also impose on the director a fine of four to twelve monthly tax units.

Once the conviction sentence is final, if the clarification or rectification is not published within the term fixed by the court, and in the terms established in the first and second paragraphs of Article 19, as the case may be, the director of the medium shall be sanctioned with a fine of twelve to one hundred monthly tax units and the immediate suspension of the social communication medium shall be decreed. The court shall lift the suspension ordered from the moment the director pays the fine and accompanies a sworn statement in which he or she obliges himself or herself to fully comply with the obligation imposed in the next edition or transmission.

The director and the owner or concessionaire of the social communication medium shall be jointly and severally liable for the payment of the fines.

When, by application of the provisions of this article, a social communication medium is temporarily suspended, its staff shall receive, during the suspension period, all the remunerations to which they are legally or contractually entitled, under the same conditions as if they were in function.

Paragraph 3
Of crimes committed through a social communication medium
Article 29.- The crimes of calumny and injury committed through any social communication medium shall be punished with the corporal penalties indicated in Articles 413, 418, first paragraph, and 419 of the Penal Code, and with fines of twenty to one hundred fifty monthly tax units in the cases of No. 1 of Article 413 and Article 418; of twenty to one hundred monthly tax units in the case of No. 2 of Article 413 and of twenty to fifty monthly tax units in the case of Article 419.

Personal appreciations made in specialized commentaries of political, literary, historical, artistic, scientific, technical and sports criticism do not constitute injuries, except that their tenor reveals the intention to insult, in addition to criticize.

Article 31.- Anyone who, by any social communication medium, makes publications or broadcasts intended to promote hatred or hostility regarding persons or collectives on grounds of their race, sex, religion or nationality shall be punished with a fine of twenty-five to one hundred monthly tax units. In case of recurrence, the fine may be increased up to two hundred monthly tax units.

Article 32.- The dissemination of news or information emanating from trials, proceedings or pending or related judicial procedures may not be invoked as an exculpatory or attenuating circumstance of civil or criminal liability, when such dissemination, by itself, constitutes the crimes of calumny, injury or public outrage against good customs.

Specialized legal publications are excepted from the provision of the preceding paragraph, which shall not give rise to civil or criminal liability for the dissemination of news or information of proceedings or judicial procedures that were related or, if they were pending, provided that the interested parties are not individualized.

Article 33.- The disclosure, by any social communication medium, of the identity of minors who are perpetrators, accomplices, concealors or witnesses of crimes, or of any other background that leads to their identification, is prohibited.

This prohibition shall also apply with respect to victims of the crimes contemplated in Articles 141, final paragraph; 142, final paragraph; 150 A, 150 D, of some of the crimes contemplated in Title Seven of Book Two, "Crimes and offenses against the order of families, against public morality and against sexual integrity" and of the crimes contemplated in Articles 411 quater, when committed for purposes of sexual exploitation, and 433, number 1, in relation to rape, all of the Penal Code, unless they expressly consent to the disclosure.

To report the investigation or trial, the victim must be referred to either by initials, a number or any other manner that does not allow his or her identification. In addition, the use of any editorial resource that reflects stereotypes or prejudices regarding his or her status as a victim, possible responsibility in the facts, prior or subsequent conduct to the crime or any other element that normalizes, justifies or relativizes the violence suffered must be avoided.

Violation of this article shall be sanctioned with a fine of thirty to one hundred fifty monthly tax units. In case of repetition, the fine shall be doubled.

Article 34.- Whoever commits any of the crimes of public outrage against good customs contemplated in Articles 373 and 374 of the Penal Code, through a social communication medium, shall be punished with minor imprisonment in its minimum to medium degree and a fine of eleven to eighty monthly tax units.

An aggravating circumstance of public outrage to good customs shall be the incitement or promotion of the perversion of minors or that the crime is committed within a radius of two hundred meters of a school, college, institute or any educational or asylum establishment intended for children and youth.

Article 35.- Social communication media are exempt from criminal liability with respect to the publication of opinions expressed by parliamentarians in the cases indicated in the first paragraph of Article 58 of the Political Constitution, and from allegations made by lawyers before the courts of justice.

Article 36.- Whoever, outside the cases provided by the Constitution or the law, and in the exercise of public functions, obstructs or prevents the free dissemination of opinions or information through any social communication medium shall suffer the penalty of minor imprisonment in its minimum degree or a fine of forty to one hundred monthly tax units.
Article 37.- Repealed.

Article 38.- Any relevant fact or act relating to the modification or change in the ownership of a social communication medium must be reported to the National Economic Prosecutor’s Office within thirty days of its execution.

However, in the case of social communication media subject to the concession system granted by the State, the relevant fact or act shall, prior to its perfection, have a report from the National Economic Prosecutor’s Office referring to its effect on competition, which shall issue it within thirty days following receipt of the background. In the event that the report is unfavorable, the National Economic Prosecutor shall communicate it to the Court for the purposes of the provisions of Article 31 of decree with the force of law No. 1, of 2005, of the Ministry of Economy, Development and Reconstruction. If the report is not issued within the said term, it shall be understood that it does not give rise to any objection by the Prosecutor’s Office.

Article 39.- Criminal and civil liability for the crimes and abuses that are committed in the exercise of the freedoms enshrined in the first paragraph of number 12 of Article 19 of the Political Constitution of the Republic shall be determined by the norms of this law and of the respective Codes.

The director or whomever legally replaces him or her shall also be considered an author, in the case of social communication media, when the publication or diffusion is carried out, unless it is proven that there was no negligence on his or her part.

Article 40.- The civil action to obtain compensation for damages and losses arising from crimes punished in this law shall be governed by the general rules.

The commission of the crimes of injury and calumny referred to in Article 29 shall give rise to compensation for actual damage, loss of profits and moral damage.

Article 41.- The ordinary justice shall always be competent to hear crimes committed by civilians with motive or on account of the exercise of the freedoms of opinion and information declared in the first paragraph of number 12 of Article 19 of the Political Constitution of the Republic.

This rule of competence shall prevail over any other that could alter its effects, due to the connection of crimes, the concurrence of perpetrators or the immunity enjoyed by any of the accused.

Article 42.- Whenever any of the offended requires it, the court of the case shall order the dissemination, in extract drafted by the court clerk, of the conviction sentence rendered in a proceeding for any of the crimes referred to in paragraph 3 of Title IV of this law, in the social communication medium in which the infraction was committed, at the expense of the offender.

If the publication is not made within the time specified by the court, the provisions of the second paragraph of Article 28 shall apply.

Paragraph 4
Of the crimes committed against the freedoms of opinion and information (REPEALED)
Article 43.- Repealed.

Paragraph 5
Of liability and procedure applicable to the crimes dealt with in this law
Article 44.- Number 1 of Article 158 of the Penal Code is repealed.

Article 45.- The following final paragraph is incorporated into Article 504 of the Code of Criminal Procedure:

"The conviction sentence for Article 374 of the Penal Code shall order the total or partial destruction, as appropriate, of the printed matter or of the sound or audiovisual recordings of any type that have been seized during the process."

Article 46.- The following modifications are introduced into Law No. 12.927, on State Security:

a) Letter b) of Article 6 is replaced by the following:

"b) Those who publicly outrage the flag, the coat of arms, the name of the homeland or the national anthem;".

b) Article 16 is repealed.

c) Article 17 is replaced by the following:

"Article 17.- Criminal liability for the crimes provided for and punished in this law, committed through a social communication medium, shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of Article 39 of the law on freedoms of opinion and information and practice of journalism.".

d) Articles 18, 19, 20 and 21 are repealed.

Article 47.- The following is intercalated in number 2 of Article 50 of the Organic Code of Courts, between the words "the Ministers of State," and the expression "the Intendants and Governors": "Senators, Deputies, members of the Superior Courts of Justice, Comptroller General of the Republic, Commanders in Chief of the Armed Forces, General Director of Carabineros de Chile, General Director of the Investigative Police of Chile,".
Article 48.- Law No. 16.643, on Advertising Abuses, is repealed, except for its Article 49.

Transitory article.- For the purposes of the provisions of the second paragraph of Article 4 of this law, during the year 2010 it shall also be possible to finance, in regions declared disaster zones due to the earthquake of February 27, 2010, the reconstruction or repair of damaged infrastructure of social communication media, including equipment, installations, antennas and real property where they operate permanently.

In all regions of the country it shall also be possible to apply for financing of projects for the acquisition and installation of generator sets for sound broadcasting services.

Having complied with the provision of No. 1 of Article 82 of the Political Constitution of the Republic and because the National Congress has approved some of the observations made by the Executive and has rejected others; therefore promulgate and give effect as Law of the Republic.

Santiago, May 18, 2001. - RICARDO LAGOS ESCOBAR, President of the Republic. - Claudio Huepe García, Minister Secretary General of Government. - Nicolás Eyzaguirre Guzmán, Minister of Finance. - José Antonio Gómez Urrutia, Minister of Justice.

What I transcribe to you for your knowledge. - Sincerely yours, Carolina Tohá Morales, Undersecretary General of Government.

Constitutional Court
Bill on freedoms of opinion and information and practice of journalism

The Secretary of the Constitutional Court, who subscribes, certifies that the Honorable Chamber of Deputies sent the bill referred to in the heading, approved by the National Congress, so that this Court would exercise control of constitutionality regarding its Articles 4, second paragraph, 23, 26, 41 and 47; and by judgment of May 17, 2001, declared that Articles 4, 23, 26, 41 and 47 of the bill submitted are constitutional.

Santiago, May 17, 2001. - Rafael Larraín Cruz, Secretary.

Functions and Powers of the Council.
5. (1) The Council shall-
(a) provide strategic leadership, oversight and council guidance on implementation and development of national cyber security legal framework in Sierra Leone in order to ensure that-
(i) Sierra Leone's cybercrime policies and laws are in conformity with regional and international standards;
(ii) there is maintenance of international cooperation required for preventing and combating cybercrimes and promoting cybersecurity; and
(iii) effective prosecution of cybercrimes and cyber security matters.
(b) make recommendation to Government on issues relating to the prevention and combating of cybercrime and the promotion of cyber security in Sierra Leone;
(c) provide general policy guidelines for the implementation of this Act; and
(d) promote the development of educational programs and research in cyber security defences, techniques and processes.
(2) The Council shall have power to regulate its proceedings and make standing orders with respect to the holding of its meetings, notices to be given, the keeping of minutes of its proceedings and such other matters as Council may from time to time determine.

Establishment of National Cyber Security Fund.
6. (1) There is established a fund which shall be known as the National Cyber Security Fund.
(2) There shall be paid and credited into the Fund established under subsection (1) and domiciled in the Central Bank of Sierra Leone -
(a) grants-in-aid and assistance from donor, bilateral and multilateral agencies;
(b) all other sums accruing to the Fund by way of gifts, endowments, bequests or other voluntary contributions by persons and organisations: Provided that the terms and conditions attached to such gifts, endowments, bequests or contributions will not jeopardize the functions of the Council; and
(c) allocation from the consolidated fund;
(d) all other monies or assets that may, from time to time accrue to the Fund.
(3) An amount not exceeding 30 percent of the Fund may be allocated for programs relating to public education and awareness raising on cyber security issues.
(4) (i) The office of the National Computer Security Incidence Response Coordination Centre shall keep proper records of the accounts in a form approved by the Auditor General.

In case of satisfaction of the petition of person concerning which proceeedings about administrative offense are conducted about consideration of the case on the residence of this person, prescriptive limit of administrative prosecution stops from the moment of satisfaction of this petition until receipt of case papers to the judge, in body or to the of�cial, the representative to consider case on the residence of this person.

Article 34. Concept of administrative punishment Administrative punishment is the enforcement power of responsibility established by this Code applied by the judge, authorized state body or the authorized of�cer to physical person, the individual entrepreneur, the of�cial or legal entity for making of administrative offense.

Article 35. Purpose of administrative punishment 1. Administrative punishment is applied for the purpose of education of person who made administrative offense in the spirit of steady compliance with laws, and also the prevention of making of new administrative offenses by both the offender, and other persons.

Article 35. Purpose of administrative punishment 2. Administrative punishment cannot aim at humiliation of advantage of person who made administrative offense, or causing pain and suffering, physical or moral, intimidation, discrimination of any nature or humiliation of human dignity to physical person or causing damage of goodwill of the legal entity who made administrative offense.

Article 36. Types of administrative punishments 1. For making of administrative offenses the following administrative punishments are established and applied: - prevention; - administrative penalty; - administrative suspension of action of the license for implementation of certain types of activity; - deprivation of the license for implementation of certain types of activity; - deprivation of physical person of the special right; - administrative suspension of certain type of activity; - paid forced withdrawal of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense; - conscation of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense; - administrative expulsion out of limits of the Republic of Tajikistan the foreign citizen or the stateless person; - administrative detention.

Article 36. Types of administrative punishments 2. The administrative punishments provided in paragraphs the second, third, the fourth, the sixth, seventh and eighth part one of this Article are applied to the legal entity.
Article 36. Types of administrative punishments 3. The administrative punishments provided in part one of this Article can be established only by this Code.

Article 37. Main and additional administrative punishments 1. The prevention, administrative penalty, administrative detention, suspension of action of the license, deprivation of the license, administrative suspension of certain type of activity can be established and be applied only as the main administrative punishments.

Article 37. Main and additional administrative punishments 2. Deprivation of physical persons of the special right, paid forced withdrawal and conscation of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense also administrative expulsion out of limits of the Republic of Tajikistan of foreign citizens or stateless persons can be established and be applied as the primary and additional punishment.

Article 37. Main and additional administrative punishments 3. For one administrative offense the basic or the basic and additional administrative punishment from among the penalties provided in the applied Articles of the Special part of this Code can be imposed.

Article 38. Prevention The prevention as measure of administrative punishment is taken out to person who made administrative offense, in writing according to the procedure, established by the relevant articles of the Special part of this Code.

Article 39. Administrative penalty 1. Administrative penalty - type of administrative punishment in the form of cash collection in the income of the state, appointed by the judge, authorized state body or the authorized of�cer to person who made administrative offense according to the procedure, established by this Code.

Article 39. Administrative penalty 2. The size of administrative penalty is determined as a percentage or in multiple size, proceeding from: - the indicator for calculations established from the date of the termination or suppression administrative, and in case of lasting - administrative offense, from the date of its detection; - costs of subject of administrative offense at the time of the termination or suppression of administrative offense, and in case of the lasting administrative offense from the date of its detection; - the amounts of unpaid taxes and other obligatory payments or the amount of the illegal currency transactions which are subject to payment from the date of the termination or suppression of administrative offense, and in case of the lasting administrative offense - from the date of its detection; - costs of the performed works.

Article 39. Administrative penalty 3. The minimum size of the administrative penalty imposed on physical person and the individual entrepreneur functioning on the basis of the patent cannot be less than one, on of�cials - less than three, on the individual entrepreneur functioning on the basis of the certicat and the legal entity - less than ten indicators for calculations.

Article 39. Administrative penalty 4. The maximum size of the administrative ne which is ordered to pay on physical person and the individual entrepreneur functioning on the basis of the patent cannot exceed hundred indicators for calculations, on the of�cial - two hundred indicators for calculations, on the individual entrepreneur functioning on the basis of the certicat, three hundred indicators for calculations on the legal entity - one thousand indicators for calculations or two hundred percent from the amount of unpaid taxes and other obligatory payments if the Special part of this Code does not establish other size.

Article 39. Administrative penalty 5. Administrative cases in which the size of penalties exceeds three hundred indicators for calculations except for of cases on administrative offenses in the �eld of the taxation and the antitrust law is considered by the judge.
Article 39. Administrative penalty 6. The amount of administrative penalty is transferred into the republican budget.

Article 40. Administrative suspension of action of the license for implementation of certain type of activity 1. Administrative suspension of action of the license for implementation of certain type of activity provided by authorized state body to physical person or legal entity is applied for violation by the licensee of licensed requirements and conditions only in the cases provided by the relevant articles of the Special part of this Code.

Article 40. Administrative suspension of action of the license for implementation of certain type of activity 2. The term of administrative suspension of action of the license for implementation of certain type of activity cannot be more than six months.

Article 40. Administrative suspension of action of the license for implementation of certain type of activity 3. Administrative punishment in the form of suspension of action of the license for implementation of certain type of activity is appointed by licensed body.

Article 41. Deprivation of the license for implementation of certain type of activity 1. Deprivation of the license for implementation of certain type of activity provided by authorized state body or to physical person or legal entity is applied for systematic violation by the licensee of licensed requirements and conditions only in the cases provided by the relevant articles of the Special part of this Code.

Article 41. Deprivation of the license for implementation of certain type of activity 2. Administrative punishment in the form of deprivation of action of the license for implementation by certain type of activity is imposed by the judge.

Article 42. Deprivation of the special right granted to physical person 1. Deprivation of the special right granted to physical person (the rights of control of vehicles, the rights of hunting, the right of storage, carrying rearms, the right to operation of radio-electronic means or high-frequency devices, right to use by the parcels of land, etc.) for making of administrative offense, is established and applied for rough or systematic abuse of regulations of use of this right, in the cases provided by Articles of the Special part of this Code. Term of deprivation of the special right is established for a period of two months up to ten years.
Article 42. Deprivation of the special right granted to physical person 2. The decision on purpose of administrative punishment in the form of deprivation of the special right is made by the judge.

Article 42. Deprivation of the special right granted to physical person 3. Deprivation of the special right in the form of the right of control of vehicles cannot be applied to persons who use these vehicles in connection with disability, or the vehicle is the main source of means of livelihood of person, except as specied drivings in state of intoxication, non-obedience to legal requirements of the police of�cer, and also unauthorized leaving of the place of the road accident which participants they are.

Article 43. Administrative suspension of certain type of activity 1. Administrative suspension of certain type of activity consists in the temporary termination of activities of the physical persons performing business activity without formation of legal entity, activities of legal entities, their branches, representations, structural divisions, production sites, and also operation of aggregates, objects, buildings and constructions, implementation of separate types of activity, works, rendering services.

Article 43. Administrative suspension of certain type of activity 2. Administrative suspension of certain type of activity is applied in case of threat of life and to human health, emergence of epidemic, epizooty, infection (contamination) of quarantinable objects with quarantine objects, approaches of radiation accident or technogenic catastrophe, causing essential harm to condition and quality of the environment or in case of making of administrative offense in the �eld of drug traf king, psychotropic substances and their precursors, production of ethyl alcohol, alcoholic and alcohol-containing, and also tobacco products and in other cases which are directly provided by the relevant articles of the Special part of this Code.

Article 43. Administrative suspension of certain type of activity 3. Administrative suspension of operations is established for a period of up to three months and is appointed competent authority only in cases and according to the procedure, provided by the relevant articles of the Special part of this Code.

Article 43. Administrative suspension of certain type of activity 4. The competent authority according to the petition of physical person, individual entrepreneur, of�cial or legal entity ahead of schedule stops execution of administrative punishment in the form of administrative suspension of certain type of activity if it is determined that the circumstances specied in the parts two of this Article which formed the basis for imposing of this administrative punishment are eliminated.

Article 44. Paid forced withdrawal of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 1. Paid forced withdrawal of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense consists in its forced withdrawal and the subsequent realization with transfer of the realized sum to the former owner less selling expenses of the withdrawn subject.

Article 44. Paid forced withdrawal of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 2. The procedure for application of paid forced withdrawal and the list of the objects which are subject to withdrawal are established by this Code and other regulatory legal acts of the Republic of Tajikistan. Paid forced withdrawal is appointed only by the judge.

Article 44. Paid forced withdrawal of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 3. Paid forced withdrawal shall correspond to nature of committed administrative offense.

Article 44. Paid forced withdrawal of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 4. The property of the third party which does not belong to the offender is exposed to paid forced withdrawal only when it is proved that during its acquisition the third party was informed on intention of the offender.

Article 45. Conscation of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 1. Conscation of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense consists in the forced non-paid address of this subject to property of the state. Conscation of such subject is appointed only by the judge. Only the subject belonging on the property right to the offender is subject to conscation if other is not provided by legal acts of the Republic of Tajikistan.
Article 45. Conscation of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 2. Conscation shall correspond to nature of committed administrative offense.

Article 45. Conscation of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 3. Withdrawal from adverse possession of person who made administrative offense, tools of making or direct object of administrative offense is not conscation: - subject according to the legislation of the Republic of Tajikistan to return to their legal owner; - the person withdrawn from civil circulation or being for other reasons in adverse possession who made administrative offense, and on this foundation of the state which is subject to the address to property or to destruction.

Article 45. Conscation of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 4. Subject, been the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense which does not belong to the offender, and is property of the third parties, except for administrative offenses in the �eld of the customs legislation, is exposed to conscation only when it is proved that during their acquisition the third party was informed on the offense fact.

Article 45. Conscation of the subject which was the tool of making or direct object of administrative offense 5. The procedure for application of conscation and the list of the objects which are not subject to conscation are established by this Code and other regulatory legal acts of the Republic of Tajikistan.

Article 46. Administrative expulsion from the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan foreign citizens and stateless persons 1. Administrative expulsion from the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan of foreign citizens and stateless persons as administrative punishment, consists in forced departure of foreign citizens and stateless persons from the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan in cases: - if their acts (actions or failure to act) contradict interests of ensuring public and state security or protection of public order; - if it is measure it is necessary for health protection and morality of the population, protection of the rights and legitimate interests of citizens of the Republic of Tajikistan and other persons; - if they violated requirements of legal acts of the Republic of Tajikistan.

Article 46. Administrative expulsion from the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan foreign citizens and stateless persons 2. Administrative expulsion from the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan of foreign citizens and stateless persons is performed by forced and controlled movement of specied persons through Frontier of the Republic of Tajikistan out of limits of the Republic of Tajikistan in cases of violation of procedure for stay in the Republic of Tajikistan by them, and in cases, directly stipulated by the legislation the Republic of Tajikistan, by controlled independent departure of foreign citizens and stateless persons from the Republic of Tajikistan.

Article 46. Administrative expulsion from the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan foreign citizens and stateless persons 3. Administrative expulsion from the territory of the Republic of Tajikistan of foreign citizens and stateless persons is established as measure of administrative punishment concerning specied persons and imposed by the judge, and in case of making by the foreign citizen or stateless person of administrative offense in case of entry into the Republic of Tajikistan by authorized state body or the authorized of�cer.

Article 47. Administrative detention 1. Administrative detention as administrative punishment consists of short-term deprivation of person of freedom for making of administrative offense and forced attraction to socially useful work on conditions and according to the procedure, determined by the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan.

Article 47. Administrative detention 2. Administrative detention consists in content of the violator in the conditions of isolation from society, is appointed the judge and is established for a period of one up to dteen days, and for violation of requirements of emergency rule for a period of up to thirty days.

Article 47. Administrative detention 3. Administrative detention is established and appointed only in exceptional cases for separate types of the administrative offenses which are directly provided by the relevant articles of the Special part of this Code and cannot be applied to expectant mothers, women raising children aged up to fourteen years, persons which did not reach eighteen-year age, disabled people of 1 and 2 groups, and also persons who reached retirement age.
Article 47. Administrative detention 4. The term of administrative detention joins administrative detention in time.
Article 48. General rules of imposing of administrative punishment 1. Administrative punishment for making of administrative offense is applied in the limits set by this Code.

Article 48. General rules of imposing of administrative punishment 2. In case of application of administrative punishment to physical person nature of the administrative offense made by it, the identity of the guilty person, its property status, circumstances mitigating the administrative responsibility and circumstances aggravating the administrative responsibility are considered.

Article 48. General rules of imposing of administrative punishment 3. In case of application of administrative punishment to the of ial nature of the administrative offense made by it, the identity of the offender, the property and of ial capacity, circumstances mitigating the administrative responsibility and circumstances aggravating the administrative responsibility are considered.

Article 48. General rules of imposing of administrative punishment 4. In case of application of administrative punishment to the legal entity nature of the administrative offense made by it, the property and �nancial position of the legal entity, circumstances mitigating the administrative responsibility and circumstances aggravating the administrative responsibility are considered.

Article 48. General rules of imposing of administrative punishment 5. In the presence of the exceptional circumstances connected with the purposes and motives of act taking into account data on the perpetrator, and also its property and �nancial position of matters for the courts about administrative offenses imposing by judges of administrative punishment below the lowest limit provided by the relevant article of the Special part of this Code is allowed. The speciced regulation is not applied to the administrative offenses provided by part of 1 Article 328, Article 332, parts 1 and 3 of Article 333, Article 334, part 2 satat 339, Articles 497-499, 577, parts 1 and 2 of Article 578, Article 579, part of 1 Article 585, Article 592, part of 1 Article 593, part of 1 Article 594, part of 1 Article 595, Articles 596 and 597 of this Code.

Article 49. The circumstances mitigating the administrative responsibility 1. The circumstances mitigating the administrative responsibility are: - frank repentance of person who made administrative offense; - the voluntary message person about the administrative offense made by it; - prevention by the perpetrator of harmful effects of administrative offense, voluntary compensation of damage or elimination of damage suffered; - making of administrative offense in condition of heat passion (affect), or in case of conuuence of difcult personal, family or other circumstances; - making of administrative offense by the minor; - making of administrative offense by the expectant mother or woman having the juvenile child or person which is bringing up alone the child aged up to eighteen years; - making of administrative offense under the inuence of threat, coercions, or owing to job, material or other dependency; - making of insigniccant administrative offense for the rst time; - making of administrative offense in case of exceeding of limits of emergency, reasonable risk.

Article 49. The circumstances mitigating the administrative responsibility 2. The judge, authorized state body, or the authorized of�cer considering case on administrative offense can acknowledge mitigating responsibility as well other circumstances which are not provided by this Code.

Article 50. The circumstances aggravating the administrative responsibility 1. The circumstances aggravating the administrative responsibility are recognized: - continuation of delinquent behavior, despite requirements of representatives of that of persons about its termination; - making of administrative offense group of persons; - involvement in making of administrative offense of the minor; - making of administrative offense in the conditions of natural disaster or in case of other force majeure; - repeated making of homogeneous administrative offense within year if for making of the rst administrative offense person was already exposed to administrative punishment on which term, stipulated in Article 53 of this Code did not expire; - the making of administrative offense in state of intoxication caused by alcohol intake, drugs, the psychotropic or other stupefying substances. The judge, authorized state body and the authorized of�cer imposing administrative punishment depending on nature of committed administrative offense can not recognize these circumstances aggravating.

Article 50. The circumstances aggravating the administrative responsibility 2. The circumstances provided by part one of this Article cannot be considered as aggravating if the speciced circumstances are provided in quality of sign of administrative offense by the relevant standards of Articles of the General part of this Code.

Article 50. The circumstances aggravating the administrative responsibility 3. The list of the circumstances aggravating the administrative responsibility is exhaustive and other circumstances aggravating responsibility are established only by this Code.

Article 51. Imposing of administrative punishment for making of several administrative offenses 1. In case of committing by person of two and more administrative offenses administrative penalties it is imposed for each committed administrative offense separately.

Act XII of 2020 on the containment of coronavirus (as in force on 31 March 2020) This document has been produced for informational purposes only. Act XII of 2020 on the containment of coronavirus The National Assembly, in order to enable the Government to take all extraordinary measures necessary for the prevention of the human epidemic occurred in 2020 causing massive disease outbreaks caused by COVID-19 infection, and for the elimination of its consequences; bearing in mind especially that due to the human epidemic, the National Assembly might be unable to hold sittings; conscious that in times fraught with danger, responsible decisions need to be taken, and even if the measures already taken and potentially to be taken appear to be unaccustomed and strange restrictions, compliance with them as well as joining forces and discipline may be the most essential reserves of Hungarians; acknowledging joint action, national coming-together, and the committed work of those working in healthcare and law enforcement, and everyone else involved; for the purpose of granting authorisation to the Government to extend the applicability of its decrees adopted during the period of state of danger, and determining the framework for this authorisation, adopts the following Act:

Section 1 This Act lays down specific rules in connection with the state of danger declared, on the basis of Article 53(1) of the Fundamental law, by the Government in Government Decree 40/2020 (11 March) on the declaration of state of danger (hereinafter “Decree”) for the prevention of the human epidemic endangering life and property and causing massive disease outbreaks, the elimination of its consequences and the protection of the health and lives of Hungarian citizens (hereinafter “state of danger”).

Section 2 (1) During the period of the state of danger, in addition to the extraordinary measures and rules laid down in Act CXXVIII of 2011 on disaster management and amending certain related Acts, the Government may, in order to guarantee that life, health, person, property and rights of the citizens are protected, and to guarantee the stability of the national economy, by means of a decree, suspend the application of certain Acts, derogate from the provisions of Acts and take other extraordinary measures.

Section 2 (2) The Government may exercise its power under paragraph (1) for the purpose of preventing, controlling and eliminating the human epidemic referred to in the Decree, and preventing and averting its harmful effects, to the extent necessary and proportionate to the objective pursued.

Section 3 (1) On the basis of Article 53(3) of the Fundamental Law, the National Assembly authorises the Government to extend the applicability of the government decrees under Article 53(1) and (2) of the Fundamental Law adopted in the state of danger until the end of the period of state of danger.
Section 3 (2) The National Assembly may withdraw the authorisation under paragraph (1) before the end of the period of state of danger.

Section 3 (3) The National Assembly confirms the government decrees referred to in paragraph (1) that have been adopted after the entry into force of the Decree, but before the entry into force of this Act.

Section 4 The Government shall regularly provide information on the measures taken to eliminate the state of danger until the measures are in effect at the sittings of the National Assembly or, in the absence thereof, to the Speaker of the National Assembly and the leaders of the parliamentary groups.

Section 5 (1) The President of the Constitutional Court (hereinafter the “President”) and the Secretary-General of the Constitutional Court shall provide for the continuous operation of the Constitutional Court during the period of state of danger and shall to this end take the measures necessary in terms of operation, case management and preparation of decisions.

Section 5 (2) The President of the Constitutional Court (hereinafter the “President”) and the Secretary-General of the Constitutional Court shall provide for the continuous operation of the Constitutional Court during the period of state of danger and shall to this end take the measures necessary in terms of operation, case management and preparation of decisions. Based on a decision by the President, the plenary sessions of the Constitutional Court and the sittings of the panels may be held also using electronic communication means until the end of the period of state of danger.

Section 5 (3) The President of the Constitutional Court (hereinafter the “President”) and the Secretary-General of the Constitutional Court shall provide for the continuous operation of the Constitutional Court during the period of state of danger and shall to this end take the measures necessary in terms of operation, case management and preparation of decisions. During the period of state of danger, the President may permit derogation from the rules of procedure of the Constitutional Court.

Section 6 (1) If dissolution of the representative body of a local government or a national minority self-government is declared, the decision to this effect shall become effective on the day following the end of the period of state of danger.

Section 6 (2) No by-elections may be called until the day following the end of the period of state of danger; the elections already called shall not be held. The distributed recommendation sheets shall be returned within fifteen days of the entry into force of the Act to the election offices, where they shall be destroyed. The elections not called or not held shall be called within fifteen days of the end of the period of state of danger.

Section 6 (3) No national and local referendums may be initiated until the day following the end of the period of state of danger; the national and local referendums already called shall not be held. All time limits specified in Chapters II to IV of Act CCXXXVIII of 2013 on initiating referendums, the European citizens’ initiative and the referendum procedure shall be interrupted. The time limits shall start to run again from the day following the end of the period of state of danger. The national and local referendums not called or not held shall be called within fifteen days of the end of the period of state of danger.
Section 7 This Act shall enter into force on the day following its promulgation.
Section 8 Repeal of this Act shall be decided by the National Assembly upon the end of the period of state of danger.

Section 10 (1) In Act C of 2012 on the Criminal Code (hereinafter “Btk.”), the following subtitle and the following section 322/A shall be added at the end of section 322:

Section 322/A (1) A person who obstructs the carrying out a) of an epidemiological isolation, observation, quarantine or monitoring ordered for the prevention of the introduction or spread of an infectious disease subject to compulsory quarantine, is guilty of a felony and shall be punished by imprisonment for up to three years.

Section 322/A (1) A person who obstructs the carrying out b) of an epidemiological isolation, observation, quarantine or monitoring during an epidemic, is guilty of a felony and shall be punished by imprisonment for up to three years.

Section 322/A (1) A person who obstructs the carrying out c) of a phytosanitary- or epizootic-related measure ordered to prevent the importation, exportation or spread of an infectious animal disease or a plant quarantine pest, or to eliminate its occurrence, is guilty of a felony and shall be punished by imprisonment for up to three years.
