Article 297.- Any individual who illegitimately imports, manufactures, carries, detains, supplies or hides explosive or incendiary substances or devices shall be punished with imprisonment of two to five years.

Article 297.- Those who with the sole object of producing terror in the public, of provoking a tumult or causing public disorders, fire firearms or throw explosive or incendiary substances against persons or properties, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six years, without prejudice to the penalties corresponding to the crime in which using such weapons they have incurred.

Article 298.- If the explosion or threat occurs in the place of a public meeting at the time it is held or if it occurs on an occasion when there is danger for the greatest number of people in times of agitation, calamity or public disasters, imprisonment shall be imposed for a time of four to eight years.
Article 299.- Shall be punished with imprisonment of four to eight years:
Article 299.- 1.- Whoever has falsified the national or foreign currency that has legal or commercial course within or outside the Republic.
Article 299.- 2.- Whoever has in any way altered the legal currency to give it the appearance of greater value.

Article 299.- 3.- Whoever in concert with someone who executed or contributed to execute the falsification or alteration of the currency, introduced it into the Republic, or put it into circulation in any way.
Article 299.- The same penalty shall be applied if he has facilitated to others the means of making it circulate.
Article 299.- If the legal or commercial value represented by the falsified or altered coins is of great importance, the penalty shall be five to ten years of imprisonment.
Article 299.- If the intrinsic value of the falsified coins is equal to or greater than that of the legal coins, the penalty shall be imprisonment of one to three years.

Article 300.- Whoever alters the legal currency by any procedure that diminishes its legal weight shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months. And whoever, in concert with the one who thus altered it, executes any of the acts specified in number 3 of the preceding article, shall be applied the same penalty.

Article 301.- Any individual who, without agreeing with the one who has executed or contributed to execute the falsification or alteration, puts falsified or altered coins into circulation shall be punished with imprisonment of one to two years.
Article 301.- If the culpable received the coins in good faith, the penalty shall be arrest for a time of one to three months.
Article 302.- The penalties established in the preceding articles shall be reduced from one eighth to one fourth if the falsification can be recognized at first sight.
Article 303.- Whoever has manufactured or kept instruments exclusively destined to the manufacture or alteration of coins shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months.

Article 304.- If the culpable of any of the crimes provided in the preceding articles, before the authority has knowledge of the fact, prevents the falsification or alteration of the coins or the circulation of those already falsified or altered, he shall be exempt from penalty.
Article 305.- For the purposes of criminal law, public credit titles shall be assimilated to coins.

Article 305.- By these expressions must be understood the titles and bearer certificates issued by the Government, which constitute negotiable titles and other papers that have legal or commercial course emanating from institutes authorized to issue them.

Article 306.- Whoever has falsified the national seals destined to authenticate the acts of the Government shall be punished with imprisonment of eighteen months to three years; and likewise, whoever has used the false seal.

Article 307.- Any individual who has falsified the seal of any of the national authorities, that of any of the States of the Republic, of any District, Section, Municipality or Public Establishment; the Seal of a Registrar, Court or any other Public Office shall be punished with imprisonment of three to twelve months.
Article 307.- The one who has used the false seals, even if the falsification is the work of a third party, shall be applied the same penalties.

Article 308.- Any individual who has falsified the stamps, punches or other marks destined by virtue of a provision of law or of the Government to establish the authenticity of an act shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months.
Article 308.- The one who has used such false objects, even if the falsification is the work of a third party, shall be applied the same penalties.
Article 308.- The one who, without having contributed to the falsification, puts on sale the objects that carry the impression of the said falsified marks shall also be imposed the same penalties.

Article 309.- Whoever has falsified only the molds of the objects indicated in the preceding articles, employing an inadequate means for reproduction and different from the use of falsified instruments, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to eighteen months, in the case of Article 306; and of three to six months, in the case of Articles 307 and 308.
Article 310.- Whoever has falsified the stamped paper, the stamps or the stamping of official paper shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months.

Article 311.- Anyone who has falsified the seals for the stamped paper, for the stamps or for any other stamped printing shall be punished with imprisonment of three to fifteen months; and also whoever has falsified any special paper that is expressly destined for the printing of said seals.

Article 312.- The one who has used the falsified stamped paper, stamped printings with the same vice or false stamps and also the one who in the same way has put on sale these objects or otherwise has launched them into circulation shall be punished with imprisonment of three to fifteen months.

Article 313.- Whoever, without having participated in any of the crimes specified in the preceding articles, retains false seals or stamps or the instruments destined for falsification, shall be punished with imprisonment of fifteen days to twelve months.

Article 314.- Whoever having procured the genuine seals, stamps, punches or marks indicated in this Chapter, makes use of them to the detriment of another or for his own or another's benefit, shall incur the penalties established in the preceding articles, but with a reduction of one third to one half.

Article 315.- Whoever has falsified or altered the tickets or vouchers of railways or other public transport companies, or has used false tickets of that kind, shall be punished with imprisonment of fifteen days to six months.

Article 316.- Whoever has erased or made disappear in any way on stamps, stamps, sealed impressions, railway tickets or those of other public transport companies the marks or passwords that had been placed on them to indicate their use, shall be punished with arrest of five to forty-five days.
Article 316.- The same penalty shall also incur whoever has made use of said objects thus altered.

Article 317.- The public official who, in the exercise of his functions has prepared, in whole or in part, some false act or has altered some true one, so that public or private persons may suffer prejudice from it, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six years.

Article 317.- If the act is among those that, by provision of law, deserve trust until their challenge or allegation of falsity, the penalty of imprisonment shall be for a time of four to seven and a half years.
Article 317.- Copies authentic of originals are assimilated to original acts when, according to law, they act as originals in the absence of the latter.

Article 318.- The public official who, when receiving or drawing up some act in the exercise of his functions, has certified as true and occurred in his presence facts or declarations that have not taken place, or omitted or altered the declarations he had received, in such a way that public or private persons may suffer prejudice from it, shall be punished with the penalties established in the preceding article.

Article 319.- The public official who has simulated a copy of some supposed public act and has issued it in legal form, or who has given a copy of some public act different from the original, the latter not being altered or suppressed, shall be punished with imprisonment of eighteen months to five years.
Article 319.- The prison penalty may not be less than thirty months if the act is among those that by provision of law deserve trust until challenge or allegation of falsity.

Article 319.- If the falsity has been committed in some certification or testimony concerning the content of the acts, so that public or private persons may suffer prejudice from it, the imprisonment shall be six to thirty months.

Article 320.- Any individual who not being a public official forges, totally or partially, a document to give it the appearance of a public instrument, or alters a true one of this species, shall be punished with imprisonment of eighteen months to five years.
Article 320.- This penalty may not be less than thirty months if the act is one of those that deserve trust until challenge or allegation of falsity by virtue of law.

Article 320.- If the falsity has been committed in the copy of a public act either by supposing the original, or altering an authentic copy, or finally issuing a copy contrary to the truth, the imprisonment shall be six to thirty months.
Article 320.- If the act is one of those that by virtue of law make faith, as previously expressed, the imprisonment may not be less than eighteen months.

Article 321.- Whoever has falsely certified before a public official or in a public act his identity or status or the identity or state of a third party, so that some prejudice may result for the public or for individuals, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to nine months.

Article 321.- The same penalty is incurred by whoever has falsely certified before a public official or in a public act other facts whose authenticity the act proves while its probative force is not destroyed, by challenge or allegation of falsity, provided that from it some prejudice may result for the public or private persons.
Article 321.- If it is an act of civil status or of the Judicial authority, the penalty shall be six to eighteen months of imprisonment.
Article 321.- Whoever in commercial titles or effects has falsely certified his own identity or that of a third party shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six months.

Article 322.- The individual who has falsified or altered, totally or partially, any deed, letter or other types of private papers, so that making use of said documents by him or another could cause prejudice to the public or private persons, shall be punished with imprisonment of six to eighteen months.

Article 323.- Whoever has used or in any way taken advantage of some false act, even if he had no part in the falsification, shall be punished with the respective penalties established in Articles 320, if it is a public act, and 322, if it is a private act.

Article 324.- When any of the crimes specified in the preceding articles has been committed in order to procure a means of proving true facts, the guilty shall be punished with imprisonment of three to twelve months if it concerns public acts; and with imprisonment of fifteen days to three months if it concerns a private document.

Article 325.- Those who, in whole or in part, have suppressed or destroyed an original act or a copy that legally substitutes it, if by this a prejudice may result for the public or for individuals, shall be punished with the respective penalties established in Articles 317, 320, 321 and 322, according to the distinctions contained therein.

Article 326.- For the application of the provisions of the preceding articles, individuals who have been authorized to attest acts to which the law attributes authenticity are assimilated to public officials.
Article 326.- For the same purpose, public acts are assimilated to wills granted only before witnesses, bills and drafts of exchange and all bearer credit titles or those transferable by endorsement.
Article 327.- Shall be punished with imprisonment of fifteen days to nine months:
Article 327.- 1.- The one who has falsified licenses, passports, itineraries or residence permits.

Article 327.- 2.- The one who in any way has altered documents originally true of the class indicated in the previous number, with the object of attributing or referring them to persons, times or places different from those expressed, or falsely makes them appear executed or fulfilled the conditions required for the validity and effectiveness of such documents.
Article 327.- 3.- The one who has made use of falsified or altered licenses, itineraries, passports or residence permits, or has given them to a third party with the same object.

Article 328.- Whoever, possessing licenses, passports, itineraries or residence permits, attributes to himself in these documents a false name or surname or a false quality, and also the one who by his testimony has contributed to such altered documents being given, shall be punished with imprisonment of fifteen days to three months.

Article 329.- The public official who, in the exercise of his ministry, has committed some of the crimes provided in the preceding articles, or has in any way cooperated in their perpetration, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to eighteen months.

Article 330.- Whoever, obliged by law to keep special registers subject to the inspection of police officials or to give them news or reports related to their own industrial or professional operations, has written or allowed to be written in the former or in the latter false indications or data, shall be punished with arrest from one to three months or a fine of twenty-five to two hundred fifty bolívares.

Article 331.- Any doctor, surgeon or health employee who for favor has given a false certificate destined to be evidence before the authority shall be punished with arrest up to fifteen days or a fine of fifty to two hundred fifty bolívares.
Article 331.- The one who has used the false certificate shall be applied the same penalty.

Article 331.- If because of the false certificate someone has been admitted or maintained in an asylum for the insane while fully sane, or if some other important harm results, the penalty shall be arrest of three to eighteen months.

Article 331.- If the act has been committed by means of money or other gifts, given or promised, for himself or for a third party, the arrest shall be for a time of forty-five days to twelve months. And it shall be for a time of one to three years if the certificate has had the consequences provided in the preceding paragraph.
Article 331.- The penalties indicated in the two preceding paragraphs shall also apply to the one who has given the money or the other presents. Everything given shall be confiscated.

Article 332.- Any public official or any other individual to whom the law allows to issue certificates who falsely affirms in any of these documents good conduct, indigence or other circumstances capable of procuring for the person favored with the certificate the benevolence or confidence of the Government or of private persons, access to public positions or employment, legal protection or aid or exemption, in short, from functions, services or public charges, shall be punished with imprisonment up to eight days, or a fine of fifty to seven hundred fifty bolívares.
Article 332.- The same penalty shall be applicable to the one who has used the false certificates.

Article 333.- Whoever, not having either the quality or the faculties indicated in the two previous articles, has falsified a certificate of those specified above or who has altered some originally true, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to three months; the same penalty shall be applied to the one who has used some certificate thus falsified or altered.

Article 334.- The penalty established in the preceding article shall be applicable to the individual who, to induce error in the agents of the authority, has presented them some true act or certificate, falsely attributing it to himself or to a third party.

Article 335.- Whoever, spreading false news or by other fraudulent means, has produced in the markets or in the stock exchanges some increase or decrease in the price of wages, goods, merchandise, fruits or negotiable titles in those places or admitted in the stock quotation lists, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to fifteen months.
Article 335.- If the crime has been committed by brokers or public exchange agents, the penalty shall be imprisonment of six to thirty months.

Article 336.- Any individual who has used weights and measures with legally falsified or altered contrast so that it may cause some prejudice to the public or to individuals shall be punished with arrest of ten to thirty days.
Article 336.- And if the use of said weights and measures has been made in a public business, the penalty shall be imprisonment of one to three months.

Article 336.- To anyone who, in the exercise of some public business, is found guilty of simple possession of falsified or altered weights and measures, he shall be punished with a fine of fifty to two hundred fifty bolívares.

Article 337.- Whoever in the exercise of his trade has deceived the buyer by delivering him one thing for another, or a thing that in reason of its origin, quality or quantity is different from the declared or agreed, shall be punished with arrest of ten days to three months. If the deception concerns precious objects, he shall be punished with imprisonment of three to nine months.

Article 338.- Whoever has falsified or altered the names, brands or distinctive signs of works of ingenuity or of the products of any industry; and likewise, whoever has used the names, brands or legally registered signs thus falsified or altered, even if the falsity arises from a third party, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to twelve months.

Article 338.- The same penalty shall be applicable to the one who has counterfeited or altered industrial designs or models and to the one who has used them thus counterfeited or altered, even if the falsity is the work of a third party.
Article 338.- The judicial authority may order that the sentence be published in a newspaper it indicates, at the expense of the convict.

Article 339.- Whoever, with the object of trading, has introduced into the country and put on sale or in any other way in circulation works of ingenuity or products of any industry with falsified or altered names, brands or distinctive signs, or with names, brands or signs capable of misleading the buyer regarding their origin or quality, if the property of the works, names, brands or signs has been legally registered in Venezuela, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to twelve months.

Article 340.- Whoever has revealed news related to inventions or scientific discoveries or industrial applications that must remain secret and of which he had knowledge by reason of his position or employment or by reason of profession, art or industry, shall be punished, at the request of the aggrieved party, with imprisonment of fifteen days to three months.
Article 340.- If the revelation has been made to some foreigner not residing in the country or to his agent, the imprisonment shall be fifteen days to six months.

Article 341.- Whoever by means of threats, violences, gifts, promises, collusions or other fraudulent means has curtailed or disturbed the freedom of public auctions or private tenders on behalf of public administrations, or who by said means has driven away buyers or bidders, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six months.

Article 341.- If the culpable is a person constituted by law or by the authority in said auctions or tenders, the imprisonment shall be six to thirty months. The aforementioned official who, by money, or other thing, given or promised to him or to third parties, refrains from attending the mentioned auctions or tenders, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to three months.
Article 342.- Those who in the cases provided by the Commercial Code or other special laws are declared guilty of bankruptcy shall be punished according to the following rules:
Article 342.- 1.- Guilty bankrupts shall be punished with arrest of six months to three years.
Article 342.- 2.- Fraudulent bankrupts shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years.

Article 342.- These penalties shall be imposed according to the gravity of the circumstances that gave rise to the bankruptcy, increasing or decreasing them within their minimum and maximum at the discretion of the Tribunal.
Article 342.- The persons indicated in Article 922 of the Commercial Code shall be punished as thieves for the acts to which the same article refers.

Article 343.- Individuals who, in accordance with the provisions of Articles 920 and 923 of the Commercial Code, are declared guilty bankrupts or fraudulent bankrupts, for the facts specified in the same articles of said Code, shall be punished, respectively, with the penalties indicated in numbers 1 and 2 of the preceding article.

Article 344.- Whoever has set fire to any building or other constructions, products of the ground not yet harvested or piled, or deposits of combustible materials, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six years.

Article 344.- If the fire has been caused in buildings intended for habitation or in public buildings, or intended for public use, a public utility enterprise or industrial plants, for the exercise of a cult, warehouses or deposits of industrial or agricultural effects, merchandise, raw materials or inflammable or explosive materials or mine materials, railways, ditches, arsenals or shipyards, the imprisonment shall be four to eight years.
Article 344.- The same penalty shall be incurred by whoever by other means causes serious damage to buildings or other industrial or commercial installations.

Article 344.- Whoever has damaged the means used for the transmission of electric power, or gas or who has caused the interruption of their supply, shall be punished with imprisonment of two to six years.
Article 345.- Those who set fire to estates, plantations or other plantations shall incur a penalty of imprisonment of one to five years.

Article 346.- Those who set fire to pastures or breeding savannas without the permission of their owners or to savannas that touch the forests that supply water to the populations, even if these are private, shall be punished with imprisonment of six to eighteen months.

Article 347.- The penalty established in Article 344 shall be applied, respectively, to anyone who, with the object of destroying, in whole or in part, the buildings or houses indicated in said article, has prepared or detonated mines, firecrackers, bombs, or other inventions or explosive devices and also to anyone who has prepared or ignited inflammable materials capable of producing such effect.
Article 348.- Any individual who has caused a flood shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years.

Article 349.- Whoever, breaking locks, dikes or other works intended for the common defense of waters or to repair some common disaster, has caused the danger of flooding or any other disaster, shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months.
Article 349.- If a flood or other common disaster has actually been caused, the penalty of the previous article shall be applied.

Article 350.- Whoever applies fire to ships, aircraft, or any other floating construction, or who causes their destruction, sinking or shipwreck, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years.

Article 351.- Whenever any of the crimes provided in the preceding articles has fallen upon works, buildings or military deposits, arsenals, riggings, ships or aircraft of the Republic or of any of its States, the prison shall be four to eight years.

Article 352.- Whoever has prepared some shipwreck, destroying, disturbing or making lacking in any way the lighthouses or other signals or employing false signals or other artifices for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months.
Article 352.- When a sinking or shipwreck actually occurs, the provisions of the preceding articles shall be applied as appropriate.

Article 353.- Whoever to prevent the extinguishing of a fire or the works of defense against sinking or a shipwreck has stolen, concealed or made unusable the material, apparatus, riggings or other means destined for extinction or defense, shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months.

Article 354.- The provisions of Articles 344, 347, 348, 349, 350 and 351 shall equally apply to the one who, committing in a building or thing of his property any of the acts provided in those, has caused the damages indicated in said articles or put third persons or external interests in danger.
Article 354.- The indicated penalty shall be increased in the proportion of one sixth to one third if the act or deed executed had the object provided in Article 466.
Article 355.- When any of the acts or deeds provided in the preceding articles has put the life of any person in danger, the penalties established in them shall be increased up to half.

Article 356.- The penalties indicated in said articles shall be reduced to imprisonment of one to three months if in the cases provided in the preceding articles it is a thing of little importance and provided that the crime does not put any person in danger, nor expose any other thing to damage.

Article 357.- Whoever by having acted with imprudence or negligence, or with lack of skill in his profession, art or industry, or by breaching regulations, orders or disciplinary provisions, has caused some fire, explosion, flood, sinking or shipwreck, some collapse or any other disaster of common danger, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to fifteen months.
Article 357.- If the crime results in danger to the life of persons, the imprisonment shall be three to thirty months, and if the death of someone results, the imprisonment shall be one to ten years.

Article 358.- Whoever places an obstacle on a route of circulation of any means of transport, opens or closes the communications of those routes, makes false signals or carries out any act with the object of preparing the danger of a catastrophe shall be punished with imprisonment of four to eight years.

Article 358.- Whoever causes interruption of the communication routes by means of explosions or who by this same means causes the derailment or shipwreck of a means of communication shall be punished with imprisonment of six to ten years.
Article 358.- Whoever assaults or illegally seizes ships, aircraft, collective or cargo means of transport, or the cargo they transport, shall be punished with imprisonment of eight to sixteen years.

Article 358.- Whoever assaults a taxi or any other collective transport vehicle to dispossess its crew or passengers of their belongings or possessions shall be punished with imprisonment of ten to sixteen years.
Article 358.- If for the commission of the crimes established in this article several persons concur, the penalty shall be increased by one third.
Article 359.- Whoever damages the railways, engines, vehicles, instruments or other objects and riggings destined for their service shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years.

Article 360.- Whoever by negligence or lack of skill in his art or profession, breach of regulations, orders or instructions, has prepared the danger of a catastrophe on a railway, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to fifteen months.
Article 360.- If the catastrophe has been consummated, the imprisonment shall be for a time of one to five years.

Article 361.- Whoever has damaged ports, docks, airports, pipelines, gas pipelines, offices, workshops, works, apparatus, pipes, posts, cables or other means used by transport or communication systems, shall be punished with imprisonment of two to five years.

Article 361.- If from the act a grave danger for public safety has derived, the penalty shall be three to six years of imprisonment; and if the act produces a disaster, the penalty shall be four to eight years of imprisonment.

Article 362.- For the proper application of criminal law, the following are assimilated to ordinary railways: any ironway with metal wheels, pneumatic, solid polyethylene and solid rubber that is exploited by means of steam, electricity or a mechanical or magnetic motor.
Article 362.- For the same purposes telegraphs, telephones destined for public service and other communicational instruments and installations are assimilated.

Article 363.- Outside the cases provided in the preceding articles, any individual who by any means has destroyed, in whole or in part, or rendered impassable the roads or works destined for public communication by land or by water, or removes with that aim the objects destined for the safety of said roads and works, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to thirty months; and if the crime has resulted in putting the life of persons in danger, the imprisonment shall be for a time of eighteen months to five years.

Article 364.- Whoever illegally fells or scrapes the heaps where springs that supply water to populations exist, even if those belong to private individuals, shall be punished, unless special provisions, with imprisonment of one to three years.
Article 364.- Whoever illegally interrupts the water service to a population center shall be punished with imprisonment of two to five years.

Article 365.- Whoever by corrupting or poisoning potable waters for public use or the items destined for public nourishment puts the health of persons in danger shall be punished with imprisonment of eighteen months to five years.

Article 366.- Any individual who has falsified or adulterated, making them harmful to health, food or medicinal substances or other effects destined for commerce shall be punished with imprisonment of one to thirty months; and likewise, whoever in any way has put on sale or to public sale the said substances thus falsified or adulterated.

Article 367.- Whoever has put on sale substances intended for food or of another kind not falsified nor adulterated, but harmful to health, without warning the buyer of this quality, shall be punished with imprisonment of fifteen days to three months.
Article 367.- Shall be punished with imprisonment of four to eight years:

Article 367.- 1.- Whoever illicitly trades, manufactures, detains and, in general, commits any illicit act of acquisition, supply or traffic of narcotics such as opium and its botanical varieties, morphine, diacetylmorphine, coca leaves, cocaine, ecgonine, the plant called marijuana, its derivatives and salts and any other narcotic or stupefying substance.

Article 367.- 2.- Whoever illicitly sows, cultivates or carries out any act of acquisition, supply or trafficking of seeds or plants that have the character of narcotics or drugs referred to in the previous ordinal.

Article 367.- Whoever, without incurring in the crimes provided in this article, destines or allows a premises to be used as a meeting place for persons who gather to use narcotic or stupefying substances, shall be punished with imprisonment of two to five years.
Article 367.- Those who attend the premises to use narcotics shall be punished with imprisonment of six months to two years and shall not enjoy the benefit of bail.

Article 367.- The penalties indicated in this article shall be increased by one third if the narcotic substances are supplied, applied or facilitated to a minor under 18 years or to those who use them for their trafficking.

Article 367.- When the culprit of any of the acts provided in this article has committed the crime by abusive exercise of a sanitary profession or any other profession or art subject to authorization or surveillance by reason of public health, the penalty shall be increased between one sixth and one fourth; and in addition the accessory penalty of disqualification to exercise his profession or activity for a time equal to that of the penalty shall be imposed, after serving the latter.

Article 368.- Whoever, being authorized to sell medicinal substances, has supplied them in species, quality and quantity different from those prescribed by the doctor or different from those declared or agreed, shall be punished with imprisonment of six to eighteen months.

Article 369.- Any individual who has put on sale or in any other way in commerce, as genuine, substances intended for food that are not genuine, although they did not result harmful to health, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to fifteen days.

Article 370.- When any of the acts provided in the preceding articles is the result of imprudence, negligence, lack of skill in the art, profession or industry or breach of regulations, orders or instructions, the culpable shall be punished as follows:
Article 370.- 1.- In the case of Article 365, with arrest of fifteen days to six months.
Article 370.- 2.- In the cases of Article 366, with arrest of fifteen to forty-five days.
Article 370.- 3.- In the cases of Articles 367 and 368, with arrest of three to fifteen days.
Article 371.- When from any of the acts provided in the preceding articles some danger to the life of persons results, the penalties established in them shall be doubled.

Article 372.- When the culprit of any of the acts provided in Articles 366 and 369 has committed the crime by abusive exercise of a sanitary profession or any other profession or art subject to authorization or surveillance by reason of public health, the penalties shall be the following:
Article 372.- 1.- In the case of Article 366, imprisonment of three months to three years.
Article 372.- 2.- In the case of Article 369, imprisonment of fifteen days to three months.

Article 372.- The conviction for any of the crimes provided in the preceding articles shall always result as a consequence in the suspension of the exercise of the art, profession or industry by means of which the crime has been committed.
Article 372.- Such suspension shall be imposed for a time equal to that of the imprisonment that would have been applied.

Article 373.- Whoever by spreading false news or using other fraudulent means has produced the scarcity and rise in price of food articles shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months. If the culpable is some public broker, said penalty shall be increased by half.

Article 374.- Whenever as a consequence of any of the crimes to which Articles 344, 347, 352, 354, 358, 359, 361, 362, 363, 365, 366, 367, 368 and 372 and except what is provided in Articles 408, number 3 and 420, the death or injury of some person results, the penalties established in them shall be doubled in case of death and shall be increased by one third to one half in case of injuries, but not less than four years of imprisonment in the first case nor three months of imprisonment in the second.

Article 374.- If from the fact the death of several persons results or the death of one and injuries of another or others, imprisonment may be converted into presidio, according to the circumstances of the case; and whether one or the other penalty is applied, its time shall not be less than ten years, and may extend up to twenty.
Article 374.- If injuries of several persons result, imprisonment shall not be less than six months, but may be raised up to ten years.
Article 375.- Whoever by means of violence or threats has forced any person, of either sex, to a carnal act, shall be punished with imprisonment of five to ten years.
Article 375.- The same penalty shall be applied to the individual who has carnal intercourse with a person of either sex who at the time of the crime:
Article 375.- 1.- Is not twelve years old.
Article 375.- 2.- Or has not reached sixteen years, if the culpable is an ascendant, guardian or teacher.
Article 375.- 3.- Or who, being detained or sentenced, has been entrusted to the custody of the culpable.

Article 375.- 4.- Or who is not in capacity to resist due to physical or mental illness; for another reason independent of the will of the culpable or as a consequence of the use of fraudulent means or narcotic or exciting substances by which he has made use.

Article 376.- When any of the acts provided in the first part and in numbers 1 and 4 of the preceding article has been committed with abuse of authority, trust or domestic relations, the penalty shall be imprisonment of six to twelve years in the case of the first part, and of five to ten years in the cases of numbers 1 and 4.

Article 377.- Whoever, taking advantage of the means and conditions or circumstances indicated in Article 375, has committed lascivious acts in any person of either sex that did not have as object the crime provided in said article, shall be punished with imprisonment of six to thirty months.

Article 377.- If the act has been committed with abuse of authority, trust or domestic relations the imprisonment penalty shall be one to five years, in the case of violence and threats; and two to six years in the cases of numbers 1 and 4 of Article 375.

Article 378.- When any of the acts provided in the preceding articles has been committed with the simultaneous concurrence of two or more persons, the penalties established by law shall be imposed with an increase of one third.

Article 379.- Whoever had carnal intercourse with a person older than twelve and younger than sixteen years, or commits lascivious acts upon her, without being her ascendant, guardian or teacher and even if none of the circumstances provided in Article 375 exists, shall be punished with imprisonment of six to eighteen months and the penalty shall be double if the author of the crime is the first who corrupts the aggrieved person.

Article 379.- Carnal intercourse carried out on a woman older than sixteen and younger than twenty-one with her consent is punishable when there has been seduction with promise of marriage and the woman is known to be honest; in such case the penalty shall be six months to one year of imprisonment.

Article 379.- A special aggravating circumstance shall be considered, in the crimes to which this article refers, that of the culpable having used the interventions of the ascendants, guardians or legal representatives or other persons in charge of watching the minor's person or the offices of pimps or habitual corruptors.
Article 380.- As regards the crimes provided in the preceding articles, prosecution shall only proceed upon accusation of the injured party or of whoever represents his rights.

Article 380.- But the complaint is not admissible if one year has elapsed from the day on which the act was committed or from the day on which the person who may file the complaint in representation of the injured person became aware of it.
Article 380.- The withdrawal shall have no effect if it intervenes after a final sentence has been rendered.
Article 380.- Proceedings shall proceed ex officio in the following cases:
Article 380.- 1.- If the act has caused the death of the offended person, or if it has been accompanied by another crime prosecutable ex officio.
Article 380.- 2.- If the act has been committed in some public place or exposed to public view.
Article 380.- 3.- If the act has been committed with abuse of parental power or guardianship authority or public functions.

Article 381.- Any individual who, in circumstances capable of causing public scandal, has incestuous relations with an ascendant or descendant, even if illegitimate, with some in-law in the direct line or with a brother or sister, brothers, consanguineous or uterine, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six years.

Article 382.- Any individual who, outside the cases indicated in the preceding articles, has outraged decency or good morals by acts committed in a public place or exposed to public view shall be punished with imprisonment of three to fifteen months.

Article 382.- Whoever repeatedly or for profit and to satisfy the passions of another induces, facilitates or favors the prostitution or corruption of some person shall be punished with imprisonment of one to six years. If this crime is committed against a minor, the penalty shall be applied between the medium and the maximum term.

Article 383.- Any individual who has outraged decency by means of obscene writings, drawings or other objects that under any form have been made, distributed or exposed to public view or offered for sale shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six months. If the crime has been committed for profit, imprisonment shall be six months to one year.

Article 384.- Any individual who by means of violence, threats or deception has snatched, stolen or detained, with purposes of debauchery or marriage, a woman of age or emancipated, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to three years.

Article 385.- Any individual who by the means referred to in the preceding article and for any of the purposes therein provided has snatched, stolen or detained a minor person or a married woman shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years.
Article 385.- If the kidnapped has given her consent, the penalty shall be imprisonment for a time of six months to two years.
Article 385.- And if the kidnapped person is under twelve years of age, even if the culpable has not used violence, threats or deception, the penalty shall be imprisonment of three to five years.

Article 386.- When the culpable of any of the crimes provided in the preceding articles, without having committed any libidinous act, has voluntarily freed the kidnapped person, returning her to her domicile, to that of her relatives or to some safe place, at the disposal of her family, the penalty imposed shall be imprisonment of one to six months in the case of Article 384, of three to eighteen months and of six to thirty months, respectively, in the cases of Article 385.
Article 386.- When any of the crimes provided in this and the previous articles has been committed solely for the purpose of marriage, the prison penalty may be applied in place of presidio.

Article 387.- As regards the crimes provided in the preceding articles, prosecution shall only proceed upon accusation of the injured party or of his legal representative. But the complaint shall not be admissible if one year has elapsed since the fact was carried out or since the day on which the person who may promote it in representation of the injured person became aware of it.
Article 387.- The withdrawal has no effect if it intervenes after final sentence.
Article 388.- Whoever to satisfy another's passions has induced a minor to prostitution or corrupt acts shall be punished with imprisonment of three to eighteen months.
Article 388.- Imprisonment shall be imposed for one to four years if the crime has been committed:
Article 388.- 1.- By a person under twelve years old.
Article 388.- 2.- By means of fraud or deception.

Article 388.- 3.- By ascendants, in-laws in direct ascending line, adoptive father or mother, husband, guardian or other person in charge of the minor to care for, instruct, watch or guard them, even temporarily.
Article 388.- If several circumstances of different categories mentioned concur, imprisonment shall be two to five years.

Article 389.- Any individual who, to satisfy the passions of another, has facilitated or favored the prostitution or corruption of some minor, in any of the ways or in any of the cases specified in the first part and numbers 1, 2 and 3 of the preceding article, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to twelve months. In the case of the last aside, imprisonment shall be three to eighteen months.

Article 390.- The ascendant, in the direct ascending line, husband or guardian who by means of violence or threats has constrained the descendant, the wife, even if she is of age, or the minor under his guardianship to prostitution or corruption, shall be punished with imprisonment of four to six years.

Article 390.- If the ascendant or husband has used fraud or deception for the corruption of the descendant or the wife, even if she is of age, they shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years.

Article 391.- In the crimes provided in the preceding articles, prosecution shall only proceed upon accusation of the injured party or his legal representative, except when the author of the punishable act is that same legal representative.

Article 391.- When the guilty is the husband and the woman is a minor, the complaint must be brought by the person who, if she were not married, would have over her the right of parental authority or guardianship.
Article 391.- Loss of marital power shall be a consequence of the conviction.

Article 392.- As a consequence of conviction for any of the crimes provided in Articles 375, 376, 377, 379, 381, 388, 389 and 390, regarding ascendants, the loss of all rights that by their quality as such the law grants them over the person and goods of the descendants in whose detriment the crime has been committed shall ensue; and regarding guardians, the removal of guardianship and disqualification for all positions related to it.
Article 393.- When a prostitute has been the object of any of the crimes provided in Articles 375, 376, 377, 384 and 385, the penalties established by law shall be reduced to one fifth.

Article 394.- When any of the acts provided in Articles 375, 376, 377, 384 and 385 has caused the death of the offended person, the corresponding penalties to homicide increased by half shall be applied. If they produce injury, the penalty established in the cited articles increased by one third to one half shall be applied, without in any case being less than eighteen months of imprisonment.

Article 395.- The guilty of any of the crimes provided in Articles 375, 376, 377, 379, 388, 389 and 390 shall be exempt from penalty if before conviction he contracts marriage with the offended person, and the trial shall cease entirely in everything related to the penal liability corresponding to these punishable acts.
Article 395.- If the marriage is celebrated after conviction, the execution of the penalties and their criminal consequences shall cease then.

Article 395.- Those convicted of seduction, rape or kidnapping shall be condemned, by way of civil indemnity, if the marriage is not carried out, to endow the offended if she is single or widow and, in any case, honest.

Article 395.- Sole paragraph: In the same sentence it shall be declared that the offspring shall enjoy the same rights that civil law grants to legitimate children, if the status of the parents allows it and in any case the guilty shall be condemned to maintain said offspring.
Article 396.- The adulterous woman shall be punished with imprisonment of six months to three years. The same penalty applies to the co-author of the adultery.

Article 397.- The husband who keeps a concubine in the conjugal home, or also outside it, if the fact is notorious, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to eighteen months. The conviction causes by law the loss of marital power.
Article 397.- The concubine shall be punished with imprisonment of three months to one year.

Article 398.- If the spouses were legally separated, or if the culpable spouse had been abandoned by the other, the penalty of the crimes referred to in the two previous articles shall be, for each of the guilty, imprisonment of fifteen days to three months.
Article 399.- Regarding the crimes provided in the preceding articles, prosecution shall only proceed upon accusation of the husband or the wife.
Article 399.- The complaint shall necessarily include the co-author of the adultery or the concubine.
Article 399.- The instance or complaint is not admissible if one year has elapsed from the date on which the offended spouse had knowledge of the committed adultery.
Article 399.- The accusation shall not be admissible either if it proceeds from the spouse by whose fault a sentence of separation of bodies has been pronounced.
Article 400.- The guilty of any of the crimes provided in the preceding articles shall be exempt from penalty:

Article 400.- 1.- In the case of accusation or complaint by the husband, when the woman proves that he had also in the year prior to the act committed the crime specified in Article 397, or had forced or exposed his wife to prostitution or incited or favored her corruption.
Article 400.- 2.- In the case of accusation by the wife when the husband proves that she also, during the time indicated above, has committed the crime referred to in Article 396.
Article 401.- Withdrawal may effectively proceed even after the conviction, making the execution and penal consequences cease.
Article 401.- The death of the accusing spouse produces the effects of withdrawal.

Article 402.- Whoever being validly married has contracted another marriage, or who not being so has contracted, knowingly, marriage with a legitimately married person, shall be punished with imprisonment of two to four years.

Article 402.- If the culpable has induced error in the person with whom he has contracted marriage, deceiving her regarding the freedom of his own state or hers, the penalty shall be imprisonment of three to five years.

Article 402.- The penalties above shall be increased by one fifth to one third for the one who, being validly married, has contracted another marriage knowing that the other contracting party was also legitimately married.

Article 403.- Those convicted of bigamy shall be condemned, by way of civil indemnity, to maintain the underage offspring and if the innocent contracting party is single and it has not been established that she is not honest, they shall also be condemned to endow her.

Article 404.- The prescription of the criminal action for the crime provided in Article 402 shall run from the day on which one of the two marriages has been dissolved, or from the day on which the second marriage has been declared null by cause of bigamy.

Article 405.- Whoever by hiding or changing a child has thus suppressed or altered its civil status, as well as the one who has made a child that does not exist appear in the civil status registers, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years.

Article 405.- Whoever, outside the cases provided in the first part of this article, places in some foundling home or other charitable place a legitimate or recognized natural child, or presents him in such establishments hiding his status, shall be punished with imprisonment of forty-five days to three years; and if the culpable is an ascendant, the prison penalty may be up to four years.

Article 406.- The guilty of any of the crimes provided in the preceding article who has committed the act to save his own honor or the honor of his wife, of his mother, of his descendant, of his adoptive daughter or sister, or to prevent imminent ill-treatment, shall be punished with imprisonment of fifteen days to eighteen months.
Article 407.- Whoever intentionally has given death to some person shall be punished with imprisonment of twelve to eighteen years.
Article 408.- In the cases enumerated below the following penalties shall be applied:

Article 408.- 1.- Fifteen to twenty-five years of imprisonment to whoever commits homicide by means of poison or fire, sinking or other of the crimes provided in Title VII of this book, with treachery or for futile or ignoble motives, or in the course of the execution of the crimes provided in Articles 453, 454, 455, 457, 460 and 462 of this Code.
Article 408.- 2.- Twenty to twenty-six years of imprisonment if two or more of the circumstances indicated in the preceding numeral concur in the act.
Article 408.- 3.- Twenty to thirty years of imprisonment for those who perpetrate it:
Article 408.- a) In the person of his ascendant or descendant, legitimate or natural, or in that of his spouse.
Article 408.- b) In the person of the President of the Republic or of whoever exercises, even temporarily, the functions of said office.
Article 409.- The penalty for the crime provided in Article 407 shall be fourteen to twenty years of imprisonment:
Article 409.- 1.- For those who perpetrate it in the person of his brother.

Article 409.- 2.- For those who commit it in the person of the Executive Vice President of the Republic, of any of the Magistrates of the Supreme Court of Justice, in the person of any member of the Executive Directorate of the Judiciary, a Cabinet Minister, a member of the National Assembly, of the State Legislative Councils, of the Major Mayor of the Metropolitan District of Caracas, of any member of the National Electoral Council, of the Investigative Commission against Illicit Enrichment of Public Officials or Employees, or of the Attorney General, Prosecutor General or Comptroller General of the Republic. In the person of any member of the National Armed Force, of the Police or of any other public official, provided that with respect to the latter the crime has been committed due to their functions.

Article 410.- In the cases provided in the preceding articles, when death has not occurred without the concurrence of preexisting circumstances unknown to the culprit, or of unforeseen causes that have not depended on his act, the penalty shall be imprisonment of seven to ten years, in the case of Article 407; of ten to fifteen years, in the case of Article 408; and of eight to twelve years in the case of Article 409.

Article 411.- Whoever by having acted with imprudence or negligence, or with lack of skill in his profession, art or industry, or by breaching regulations, orders or instructions, has caused the death of some person, shall be punished with imprisonment of six months to five years.
Article 411.- In the application of this penalty the Courts of Justice shall appreciate the degree of culpability of the agent.

Article 411.- If from the act the death of several persons or the death of a single one and the wounds of one or more result, provided that the wounds carry the consequences provided in Article 416, the imprisonment penalty may increase up to eight years.

Article 412.- Whoever with acts directed to cause a personal injury causes the death of someone shall be punished with imprisonment of six to eight years, in the case of Article 407; of eight to twelve years, in the case of Article 408; and of seven to ten years, in the case of Article 409.

Article 412.- If death would not have occurred without the concurrence of preexisting circumstances unknown to the culprit, or causes unforeseen or independent of his act, the penalty shall be imprisonment of four to six years, in the case of Article 407; of six to nine years, in the case of Article 408; and of five to seven years, in the case of Article 409.

Article 413.- When the crime provided in Article 407 has been committed upon a newly born child, not registered in the Civil Status Registry within the legal term, with the object of saving the culprit's honor or the honor of his wife, his mother, his descendant, sister or adoptive daughter, the penalty indicated in said article shall be reduced by one quarter to one half.
Article 414.- Whoever has induced some individual to commit suicide or with that aim has helped him shall be punished, if the suicide consummates, with imprisonment of seven to ten years.

Article 415.- Whoever without intent to kill, but with intent to cause him harm, has caused to some person a physical suffering, a detriment to health or a disturbance in intellectual faculties, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to twelve months.

Article 416.- If the act has caused a mental or bodily illness, certain or probably incurable, or the loss of some sense or a hand, a foot, speech, the capacity to beget or the use of some organ, or if it has produced some wound that disfigures the person; in short, if having been committed the crime against a pregnant woman it has caused abortion, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six years.

Article 417.- If the act has caused permanent disablement of some sense or organ, permanent difficulty of speech or some notable scar on the face or has endangered the life of the offended person or produced some mental or bodily illness that lasts twenty days or more, or if for an equal time the said person is incapacitated from engaging in habitual occupations, or if having been committed the crime against a ...

Article 416.- If the act has caused a mental or bodily illness, certainly or probably incurable, or the loss of any sense or of a hand, of a foot, of speech, of the capacity to engender or of the use of any organ, or if it has produced any wound that disfigures the person; in short, if, having committed the crime against a pregnant woman it has caused abortion, the offender shall be punished with imprisonment (presidio) of three to six years.

Article 417.- If the act has caused permanent disablement of any sense or of an organ, permanent difficulty of speech or some notable scar on the face or if it has put the life of the offended person in danger or produced some mental or bodily illness that lasts twenty days or more, or if for an equal time said person is incapacitated from engaging in his usual occupations, or, in short, if, having committed the crime against a pregnant woman, it causes a premature birth, the penalty shall be imprisonment of one to four years.

Article 418.- If the crime provided for in Article 415 has brought about in the offended person an illness that requires medical assistance for less than ten days only or has only incapacitated them for an equal time to attend to their ordinary business or habitual occupations, the penalty shall be arrest of three to six months.

Article 419.- If the crime provided for in Article 415 has not only not caused an illness that requires medical assistance, but has also not incapacitated the offended person to attend to their business or habitual occupations, the penalty shall be arrest of ten to forty-five days.

Article 420.- When the act specified in the preceding articles is accompanied by any of the circumstances indicated in Article 408, or when the act is committed with insidious weapons or with any other weapon properly so called, or by means of corrosive substances, the penalty shall be increased in the proportion of one sixth to one third.

Article 420 (continued).- If the act is accompanied by any of the circumstances provided for in Article 409, the penalty shall be increased by one third, without prejudice to the penalty for the concurrent punishable act that cannot be considered as an aggravating circumstance but as a separate crime.

Article 421.- When in the cases provided for in the preceding articles the consequences of the act exceed the purpose the guilty party intended, the penalty established therein shall be diminished by one third to one half.

Article 422 (chapeau).- Whoever, by having acted with imprudence or negligence, or with lack of skill in his profession, art or industry, or by nonobservance of regulations, orders or disciplines, causes another some bodily harm or to his health, or some disturbance in intellectual faculties, shall be punished:

Article 422.- Whoever, by having acted with imprudence or negligence, or with lack of skill in his profession, art or industry, or by nonobservance of regulations, orders or disciplines, causes another some bodily harm or to his health, or some disturbance in intellectual faculties, shall be punished: 1.- With arrest of five to forty-five days or a fine of fifty to five hundred bolívares, in the cases specified in Articles 415 and 418, proceedings being only by complaint of the injured party.

Article 422.- Whoever, by having acted with imprudence or negligence, or with lack of skill in his profession, art or industry, or by nonobservance of regulations, orders or disciplines, causes another some bodily harm or to his health, or some disturbance in intellectual faculties, shall be punished: 2.- With imprisonment of one to twelve months or a fine of one hundred fifty to one thousand five hundred bolívares, in the cases of Articles 416 and 417.

Article 422.- Whoever, by having acted with imprudence or negligence, or with lack of skill in his profession, art or industry, or by nonobservance of regulations, orders or disciplines, causes another some bodily harm or to his health, or some disturbance in intellectual faculties, shall be punished: 3.- With arrest of one to five days or with a fine of twenty-five bolívares, in the cases of Article 401, proceedings being only by complaint of the injured party.
Article 423.- The husband who, surprising his wife in adultery and her accomplice, kills, wounds or mistreats one of them or both, shall not incur the common penalties for homicide nor for injuries.
Article 423 (continued).- In such cases the penalties for homicide or injuries shall be reduced to imprisonment that does not exceed three years nor be less than six months.

Article 423 (continued).- The same mitigation of penalty shall take effect in homicides or injuries that parents or grandparents execute, in their own home, against men who they surprise in carnal act with their unmarried daughters or granddaughters.

Article 424.- The Courts shall consider as a mitigating motive in trials for death or bodily injuries that the acts were caused in a regular duel. In this case the penalty corresponding to the punishable act may be reduced by one to two thirds; and the witnesses shall be applied a penalty equal to that imposed on the killer or wounding party, diminished by half.

Article 424 (continued).- If in a duel there has been treachery, this circumstance shall be considered aggravating for the application of the penalties corresponding to the homicide or injuries that have resulted; and the witnesses shall be considered as co-authors.

Article 424 (continued).- In the case of homicide committed in a hand-to-hand brawl, if the wounded or deceased provoked it and although the wounding or killing party accepted it or continued it despite having been able to stop it or to abstain from fighting without grave risk, that circumstance shall be taken into account and the corresponding penalty shall be applied with the mitigation provided in the first part of this Article.

Article 424 (continued).- In these cases, if the encounter originated because one of the parties offended the honor or reputation of the other or of his family in a public document or with writings or drawings disseminated or exposed to the public or by other means of publicity, the author of these acts shall be considered the provoker; and depending on the gravity of the defamation, the Courts may change the penalty that would correspond to the one who wounded or killed the provoker into confinement for an equal time, with the reduction provided.

Article 425.- The individual who has committed any of the acts provided for in the two preceding Chapters shall not be punishable if he was defending his own goods against authors of scaling, burglary or fire of his house, of other inhabited buildings or their dependencies, provided that the crime takes place at night or in an isolated place, such that the inhabitants of the house, buildings or dependencies can reasonably believe themselves threatened in their personal security.

Article 425 (continued).- When repelling the authors of the scaling, burglary or fire of the house, buildings or dependencies, the previously stated conditions do not concur, the penalty for the committed crime shall only be diminished by one third to one half, and the presidio shall be converted into imprisonment.

Article 426.- When, in the perpetration of death or injuries several persons took part and it cannot be discovered who caused them, all shall be punished with the penalties respectively corresponding to the committed crime, diminished by one third to one half.
Article 426 (continued).- This reduction of penalty shall not apply to the immediate accomplice of the act.

Article 427.- Without prejudice to the provisions of the previous Article and to the greater penalties incurred for the acts individually committed, when in a fray among several people some person results dead or with a personal injury, all who attacked the wounded shall be punished with the penalties corresponding to the committed crime. Those who took part in the fray without attacking the wounded shall be punished with imprisonment of one to three years in cases of homicide, and of one to six months in the case of injuries.
Article 427 (continued).- The instigator of the fray shall be applied the penalties indicated, increased by one third.

Article 428.- Whoever, in a brawl between two or more persons, draws first a firearm or bladed weapon, or first fires the firearm, shall be punished with arrest of one to six months, even if he causes neither death nor injury; if he does cause them, the corresponding penalty to the crime shall be applied increased by one sixth. In either case the corresponding penalty for the crime of illicit carrying of arms shall also be applied.

Article 429.- Even when, according to the classification of injuries made by experts, they were not in themselves mortal, the accused shall be punished as a homicide, pursuant to Article 412, if the death caused by such injuries with the concurrence of unforeseen circumstances referred to in said Article occurs before final sentence is pronounced.

Article 430.- For the purposes of the Chapters of this Title, weapons are deemed, in addition to firearms and bladed ones, sticks, stones and any other instruments suitable for mistreating or wounding.

Article 431.- In any case of deaths or wounds caused with prohibited weapons, the exemption or mitigation established in favor of its author with respect to the crime of homicide or personal injuries shall not favor him in regard to the crime of carrying arms, which shall be punished in accordance with the provisions of Chapter I of Title V of this Book.

Article 432.- The woman who intentionally aborts, making use for that of means employed by herself, or by a third party with her consent, shall be punished with imprisonment of six months to two years.
Article 433.- Whoever has provoked the abortion of a woman, with her consent, shall be punished with imprisonment of twelve to thirty months.

Article 433 (continued).- If as a consequence of the abortion and of the means employed to effect it, the woman's death ensues, the penalty shall be presidio of three to five years; and it shall be four to six years if death ensues because more dangerous means were used than those consented to by her.

Article 434.- Whoever has procured the abortion of a woman employing without her consent or against her will means directed to produce it, shall be punished with imprisonment of fifteen months to three years. And if the abortion is carried out, the imprisonment shall be three to five years.
Article 434 (continued).- If by cause of the abortion or of the means employed to procure it, the woman's death ensues, the penalty shall be presidio of six to twelve years.
Article 434 (continued).- If the guilty party were the husband, the penalties established in this Article shall be increased by one sixth.

Article 435.- When the guilty party of any of the crimes provided for in the preceding articles is a person who exercises the art of healing or any other profession or regulated art in the interest of public health, if such person has indicated, facilitated or employed means by which the abortion was procured in which death ensued, the penalties of law shall be applied with the increase of one sixth.
Article 435 (continued).- The conviction shall always carry as consequence the suspension of exercise of the art or profession of the guilty party, for a time equal to that of the imposed penalty.
Article 435 (continued).- No penalty shall be incurred by the practitioner who provokes the abortion as an indispensable means to save the life of the parturient.

Article 436.- The penalties established in the preceding articles shall be diminished in the proportion of one to two thirds and the presidio shall be converted into imprisonment, in the case that the author of the abortion committed it to save his own honor or the honor of his wife, of his mother, of his descendant, of his sister or of his adoptive daughter.

Article 437.- Whoever has abandoned a child under twelve years old or another person incapable of providing for his own health, by mental or bodily illness that he suffers, if the abandoned person was under the custody or care of the author of the crime, shall be punished with imprisonment of forty-five days to fifteen months.

Article 437 (continued).- If the abandonment results in some serious harm to the person or health of the abandoned or a disturbance of his mental faculties, the imprisonment shall be for a time of fifteen to thirty months; and the penalty shall be presidio of three to five years if the crime causes death.

Article 438.- The penalties established in the preceding Article shall be increased by one third: 1.- If the abandonment was made in a solitary place. 2.- If the crime was committed by the parents against a legitimate or natural child, recognized or legally declared, or by the adopter against the adoptive child or vice versa.

Article 439.- When the guilty party has committed the crime provided for in the preceding articles with a newly born child, not yet declared in the Civil Registry within the legal term, to save his own honor, or that of his wife, or that of his mother, of his descendant, of his adoptive daughter or of his sister, the penalty shall be diminished in the proportion of one sixth to one third, and the presidio shall be converted into imprisonment.

Article 440.- Whoever, having found abandoned or lost some child under seven years old or any other person incapable, by mental or bodily illness, of providing for his own preservation, omitted to immediately give notice to the authority or its agents, being able to do so, shall be punished with a fine of fifty to five hundred bolívares.

Article 440 (continued).- The same penalty shall be imposed on whoever, having found a person wounded or in a dangerous situation or appearing inanimate, omitted to render assistance to said person when this does not expose him to personal harm or danger, or to give immediate notice of the case to the authority or its agents.

Article 441.- Whoever, abusing the means of correction or discipline, has caused prejudice or danger to the health of some person who is subject to his authority, education, instruction, care, supervision or custody, or who is under his direction by reason of his art or profession, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to twelve months, according to the gravity of the harm.

Article 442.- Whoever, outside the cases provided in the preceding Article, has employed ill-treatment against any child under twelve years, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to fifteen months.
Article 442 (continued).- If the ill-treatment has been executed against a descendant, ascendant or relative in the direct line, the imprisonment shall be six to thirty months.

Article 442 (continued).- Prosecution shall take place only upon accusation of the offended party if the ill-treatment has been employed against the spouse; and if the latter is a minor the complaint may also be promoted by the persons who, if marriage did not exist, would have parental power or guardianship authority over the aggrieved.

Article 443.- In the cases provided in the preceding articles, if there is evidence that in the guilty party who exercises parental authority the acts that motivated the prosecution are habitual, the Judge shall declare that the conviction entails, with respect to said guilty party, the loss of all rights that by reason of parental authority the law confers upon him over the person and goods of the offended; and concerning the guardian they shall in any case declare the removal from guardianship and exclusion from any other tutelary functions.

Article 444.- Whoever, communicating with several persons gathered or separate, has imputed to some individual a determined fact capable of exposing him to public contempt or hatred, or offensive to his honor or reputation, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to eighteen months.

Article 444 (continued).- If the offense is committed in a public document or with writings, drawings disseminated or exposed to the public, or by other means of publicity, the penalty shall be six to thirty months of imprisonment.

Article 445.- The individual accused of the crime of defamation shall not be permitted to prove the truth or notoriety of the defamatory fact, except in the following cases: 1.- When the offended person is some public official and provided that the imputed fact relates to the exercise of his ministry; except, however, the provisions of Articles 223 and 227. 2.- When by the imputed fact a trial is initiated or is pending against the defamed person. 3.- When the complainant formally requests that the sentence also pronounce on the truth or falsity of the defamatory fact.

Article 445 (continued).- If the truth of the fact is proved or if the defamed person is, by reason of the defamation, convicted for the fact, the author of the defamation shall be exempt from the penalty except in the case that the means employed themselves constitute the crime provided in the following Article.

Article 446.- Any individual who, in communication with several persons, together or separate, has offended in some way the honor, reputation or decency of some person, shall be punished with arrest of three to eight days, or a fine of twenty-five to one hundred fifty bolívares.

Article 446 (continued).- If the act has been committed in the presence of the offended, even if he is alone, or by means of some writing directed to him or in a public place, the penalty may be raised to thirty days of imprisonment or five hundred bolívares fine, and if publicity coincides with the presence of the offended, the penalty may be raised to forty-five days of imprisonment or six hundred bolívares fine.

Article 446 (continued).- If the act has been committed making use of the means indicated in the aside of Article 444, the prison penalty shall be for a time of fifteen days to three months, or a fine of one hundred fifty to one thousand five hundred bolívares.

Article 447.- When the crime provided in the preceding Article has been committed against some person legitimately in charge of some public service, in his presence and by reason of said service, the guilty shall be punished with arrest of fifteen to forty-five days.
Article 447 (continued).- If there is publicity the imprisonment may be imposed for one to two months.

Article 448.- When in the cases provided in the two preceding Articles the offended has been the unjust and determining cause of the act, the penalty shall be reduced by the proportion of one to two thirds.
Article 448 (continued).- If the offenses were reciprocal, the Judge may, according to the circumstances, declare the parties or some of them exempt from any penalty.
Article 448 (continued).- He who was driven to the crime by violences executed against his person shall not be punishable.

Article 449.- Offenses contained in writings presented by the parties or their representatives, or in speeches pronounced by them in court before the Judge during the course of a trial, produce no action; but independently of the application of disciplinary provisions of the case which the Tribunal shall impose, that authority may order the total or partial suppression of the defamatory passages, and if the offended party requests it, may also prudently grant him pecuniary reparation when pronouncing on the cause.

Article 450.- In case of conviction for any of the crimes specified in this Chapter, the Judge shall order the confiscation and suppression of the printed materials, drawings and other objects that served to commit the crime; and if they are writings with respect to which suppression cannot be ordered, he shall order that a reference to the sentence pronounced in relation to the case be made in the margin of them.
Article 450 (continued).- At the complainant's request, the condemnatory sentence shall be published at the expense of the convicted, once or twice, in the newspapers indicated by the Judge.
Article 451.- The crimes provided in this Chapter may not be prosecuted except by accusation of the aggrieved party or their legal representatives.

Article 451 (continued).- If the aggrieved dies before making use of his action, or if the crimes were committed against the memory of a deceased person, the accusation or complaint may be promoted by the spouse, the ascendants, the descendants, brothers or sisters, nephews, the relatives in the direct line and by immediate heirs.

Article 451 (continued).- In the case of offense against some Judicial, political or administrative Body, or against representatives of said Body, prosecution shall not take place except with authorization of the Body or its hierarchical chief, if it is not constituted as a college or corporation.
Article 451 (continued).- In these cases, procedure shall follow as ordered in Article 226.

Article 452.- The criminal action for prosecution of the crimes provided in this Chapter shall prescribe in one year in the cases referred to in Article 444, and in three months in the cases specified in Articles 446 and 447.

Article 453.- Anyone who takes possession of some movable object belonging to another to take advantage of it, removing it without the consent of its owner from the place where it was, shall be punished with imprisonment of six months to three years.
Article 453 (continued).- If the value of the stolen thing does not exceed one hundred bolívares, the penalty shall be arrest of one to three months.

Article 453 (continued).- The same crime is committed when the imputed act falls upon things that make part of an inheritance not yet accepted, and by a co-owner, associate or co-heir, concerning common things or the undivided inheritance, provided the guilty did not have the thing in his power. The amount of the crime shall be estimated after deducting the part corresponding to the guilty.
Article 453 (chapeau to list).- The following shall incur the penalty of presidio of six months to three years:
Article 453.- Whoever alters, defaces or erases the brand on live animals or merely on hides shall incur the penalty of presidio of six months to three years.

Article 453.- Whoever buys, exchanges, alienates or conceals in any way animals or hides that turn out to be stolen or that appear with adulterated or erased brands shall incur the penalty of presidio of six months to three years.
Article 453.- Whoever brands or marks in another's property without the consent of the owner ear-marking animals shall incur the penalty of presidio of six months to three years.
