Art. 35. The Presidential Order No. 66-156 of 8 June 1966, cited above, is completed by an article 320 bis drafted as follows:

Art. 320 bis. The provisions of article 60 bis are applicable to the offences provided for by articles 314 paragraphs 3 and 4, 315 paragraphs 3, 4 and 5, 316 paragraph 4, 317 paragraphs 4 and 5 and 318 of this section.
Art. 36. Article 321 of Presidential Order No. 66-156 of 8 June 1966, cited above, is amended, completed and drafted as follows:

Art. 321. Those who, knowingly, under conditions likely to render identification impossible, move a child, traffic it, receive it as stolen, or substitute another child for it, or present it materially as having been born of a woman who has not given birth, are punished by imprisonment for five (5) ten (10) years and a fine of 500,000 DA 1,000,000 DA. If it is not established that the child lived, the penalty is imprisonment of one (1) five (5) years and a fine of 100,000 DA 500,000 DA. If it is established that the child did not live, the guilty party is punished by imprisonment of one (1) two (2) months and a fine of 10,000 DA 20,000 DA. However, when the child has been materially presented as born of a woman who has not given birth, as a result of a voluntary handing over or abandonment by its parents, the culpable party faces the penalty of one (1) year (five (5) years) of imprisonment and a fine of 100,000 DA (500,000 DA). For the first and second cases provided for by this article, prosecution is exercised only upon complaint of the abandoned spouse. The pardon of the victim terminates criminal prosecutions.

Art. 331. Any person who, in defiance of a decision of a court rendered against him or in ignorance of an order or judgment having condemned him to pay alimony to his spouse, his ascendants, his descendants, voluntarily remains for more than two (2) months without providing the total subsistence determined by the judge nor paying the full amount of the pension, is punished by imprisonment of six (6) months (three (3) years) and a fine of 50,000 DA (300,000 DA). The guilty party may, in addition, be subject to prohibition for at least one (1) year and up to five (5) years, of one or several of the rights mentioned in article 9 bis 1 and to prohibition of residence under the conditions provided for in articles 12 and 13 of this law. The default of payment is presumed voluntary, except proof to the contrary. Insolvency resulting from habitual misconduct, laziness or drunkenness is in no case a valid excuse for the debtor. The attempt of the offence provided for in the preceding paragraph is punishable by the same penalties as the consummated offence.

Art. 37. Presidential Order No. 66-156 of 8 June 1966, cited above, is completed by an article 329 bis drafted as follows: The confiscation of objects having served in the commission of the offence is always ordered.
Art. 329 bis. Public action for the application of article 328 can only be exercised upon complaint of the victim. The pardon of the victim terminates criminal prosecutions.
Art. 38. Articles 330 and 331 of Presidential Order No. 66-156 of 8 June 1966, cited above, are amended, completed and drafted as follows:

Art. 330. Are punished by imprisonment of two (2) months (one (1) year) and a fine of 25,000 DA (100,000 DA): 1 - the father or the mother of a family who abandons, without serious motive for more than two (2) months, the family residence and shirks all their moral or material obligations resulting from parental authority or legal guardianship; the two (2) month period cannot be interrupted except by a return to the home implying the will to definitively resume family life; 2 - the husband who, without serious motive, voluntarily abandons for more than two (2) months his wife, knowing her to be pregnant; 3 - the father or the mother, whether the expiry of parental authority has been pronounced or not, who seriously compromise, by ill-treatment, pernicious examples of habitual drunkenness or notorious misconduct, by lack of care or by lack of necessary direction, the health, safety, or morality of their children or of one or more of them.

Art. 331 (recast within Art. 38 context). If the child has been materially presented as born of a woman who has not given birth, because of a voluntary handing over or abandonment by its parents, the guilty party incurs the penalty of one (1) year (five (5) years) of imprisonment and a fine of 100,000 DA (500,000 DA). If it is not established that the child lived, the penalty is imprisonment of one (1) five (5) years and a fine of 100,000 DA (500,000 DA). If it is established that the child did not live, the culprit is punished by imprisonment of one (1) two (2) months and a fine of 10,000 DA (20,000 DA). For the first and second cases provided for by this article, prosecution is exercised only upon complaint of the abandoned spouse. The pardon of the victim terminates criminal prosecutions.
Art. 39. Presidential Order No. 66-156 of 8 June 1966, cited above, is amended and completed by articles 341 bis1 and 349 bis drafted as follows:
Art. 341 bis 1. The provisions of article 60 bis are applicable to the offences provided for by articles 334, 335, 336, 337 and 337 bis of this section.
Art. 349 bis. The provisions of article 60 bis are applicable to the offences provided for by articles 342 and 344 of this section.
Art. 40. Article 350 of Presidential Order No. 66-156 of 8 June 1966, cited above, is amended, completed and drafted as follows:

Art. 350. Whoever fraudulently takes away a thing that does not belong to him is guilty of theft and punished by imprisonment of one (1) year (five (5) years) and a fine of 100,000 DA (500,000 DA). The same penalty applies to the fraudulent taking away of water, gas and electricity. The guilty party may, in addition, be subject for at least one (1) year and up to five (5) years to the prohibition of one or several of the rights mentioned in article 9 bis 1 and to the prohibition of residence under the conditions provided for in articles 12 and 13 of this law. Art. 43. Presidential Order No. 66-156 of 8 June 1966, cited above, is completed by article 351 bis drafted as follows:

Theft is punished by criminal imprisonment (life imprisonment): 1 - if it was committed during a fire or after an explosion, a collapse, an earthquake, a flood, a shipwreck, a revolt, a riot or any other disorder; 2 - if it was carried out on an object that ensured the security of any means of transport, public or private.
Art. 44. Article 352 of Presidential Order No. 66-156 of 8 June 1966, cited above, is amended, completed and drafted as follows:

Art. 352. Are punished by imprisonment of five (5) years (ten (10) years) and a fine of 500,000 DA (1,000,000 DA), individuals guilty of theft committed on public roads or in vehicles used for the transport of passengers, mail or luggage, or within the precincts of railways, stations, ports, airports, landing or boarding quays. Given on this 10th day of June B.E. 2550 (2007)
Being the 62nd year if the present reign.
His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej has been pleasantly pleased to proclaim that as it is deemed appropriate to enact a law governing the commission of a computer-related offence.
His Majesty, therefore, granted His Royal assent for the promulgation of the Computer Crime Act in accord with the recommendation and consent of the National Legislative Assembly as follows:
Section 1 This Act shall be called the “Computer Crime Act B.E 2550 (2007)”.
Section 2 This Act will come into force 30 days following the date of its publication in the Government Gazette.
Section 3 In this Act,

Section 3 "Computer System" means a piece of equipment or sets of equipment units, whose function is integrated together, for which sets of instructions and working principles enable it or them to perform the duty of processing data automatically.

Section 3 "Computer Data" means data, statements, or sets of instructions contained in a computer system, the output of which may be processed by a computer system including electronic data, according to the Law of Electronic Transactions.

Section 3 "Computer Traffic Data" means data related to computer system-based communications showing sources of origin, starting points, destinations, routes, time, dates, volumes, time periods, types of services or others related to that computer system’s communications.

Section 3 "Service Provider" shall mean: (1) A person who provides service to the public with respect to access to the Internet or other mutual communication via a computer system, whether on their own behalf, or in the name of, or for the benefit of, another person
Section 3 "Service Provider" shall mean: (2) A person who provides services with respect to the storage of computer data for the benefit of the other person
Section 3 "Service User" means a person who uses the services provided by a service provider, with or without fee
Section 3 "Competent Official" means a person appointed by a Minister to perform duties under this Act.
Section 3 "Minister" means a Minister who has responsibility and control for the execution of this Act.

Section 4. The Minister of Information and Communications Technology shall have responsibility and control for the execution of this Act and shall have the authority to issue a Ministerial Rule for the purpose of the execution of this Act.
Section 4. A Ministerial Rule shall be enforceable upon its publication in the Government Gazette.

Chapter 1
Computer-Related Offences

Section 5. Any person illegally accessing a computer system for which a specific access prevention measure that is not intended for their own use is available shall be subject to imprisonment for no longer than six months or a fine of not more than ten thousand baht or both.

Section 6 This Act. If any person knowing of a measure to prevent access to a computer system specifically created by a third party illegally discloses that measure in a manner that is likely to cause damage to the third party, then they shall be subject to imprisonment for no longer than one year or a fine of not more than twenty thousand baht or both.

Section 7. If any person illegally accesses computer data, for which there is a specific access prevention measure not intended for their own use available, then he or she shall be subject to imprisonment for no longer than two years or a fine of not more than forty thousand baht or both.

Section 8. Any person who illegally commits any act by electronic means to eavesdrop a third party’s computer data in process of being sent in a computer system and not intended for the public interest or general people’s use shall be subject to imprisonment for no longer than three years or a fine of not more than sixty thousand baht or both.

Section 9. Any person who illegally damages, destroys, corrects, changes or amends a third party’s computer data, either in whole or in part, shall be subject to imprisonment for no longer than five years or a fine of not more than one hundred thousand baht or both.

Section 10. Any person who illegally commits any act that causes the working of a third party’s computer system to be suspended, delayed, hindered or disrupted to the extent that the computer system fails to operate normally shall be subject to imprisonment for no longer than five years or a fine of not more than one hundred thousand baht or both.

Section 11 Any person sending computer data or electronic mail to another person and covering up the source of such aforementioned data in a manner that disturbs the other person’s normal operation of their computer system shall be subject to a fine of not more than one hundred thousand baht.

Section 12. The perpetration of an offence under Section 9 or Section 10 that: (1) causes damage, whether it be immediate or subsequent and whether it be synchronous to the public shall be subject to imprisonment for no longer than ten years or a fine of not more than two hundred thousand baht.

Section 12. The perpetration of an offence under Section 9 or Section 10 that: (2) is an act that is likely to damage computer data or a computer system related to the country’s security, public security and economic security or public services or is an act against computer data or a computer system available for public use shall be subject to imprisonment from three years up to fifteen years and a fine of sixty thousand baht up to three hundred thousand baht.
Section 12. The commission of an offence under (2) that causes death to another person shall be subject to imprisonment from ten years up to twenty years.

Section 13. Any person who sells or disseminates sets of instructions developed as a tool used in committing an offence under Section 5, Section 6, Section 7, Section 8, Section 9, Section 10 and Section 11 shall be subject to imprisonment for not more than one year or a fine of not more than twenty thousand baht, or both.

Section 14. If any person commits any offence of the following acts shall be subject to imprisonment for not more than five years or a fine of not more than one hundred thousand baht or both: (1) that involves import to a computer system of forged computer data, either in whole or in part, or false computer data, in a manner that is likely to cause damage to that third party or the public;

Section 14. If any person commits any offence of the following acts shall be subject to imprisonment for not more than five years or a fine of not more than one hundred thousand baht or both: (2) that involves import to a computer system of false computer data in a manner that is likely to damage the country’s security or cause a public panic;

Section 14. If any person commits any offence of the following acts shall be subject to imprisonment for not more than five years or a fine of not more than one hundred thousand baht or both: (3) that involves import to a computer system of any computer data related with an offence against the Kingdom’s security under the Criminal Code;

Section 14. If any person commits any offence of the following acts shall be subject to imprisonment for not more than five years or a fine of not more than one hundred thousand baht or both: (4) that involves import to a computer system of any computer data of a pornographic nature that is publicly accessible;

Section 14. If any person commits any offence of the following acts shall be subject to imprisonment for not more than five years or a fine of not more than one hundred thousand baht or both: (5) that involves the dissemination or forwarding of computer data already known to be computer data under (1) (2) (3) or (4);

Section 15. Any service provider intentionally supporting or consenting to an offence under Section 14 within a computer system under their control shall be subject to the same penalty as that imposed upon a person committing an offence under Section 14.

Section 16. Any person, who imports to a computer system that is publicly accessible, computer data where a third party’s picture appears either created, edited, added or adapted by electronic means or otherwise in a manner that is likely to impair that third party’s reputation or cause that third party to be isolated, disgusted or embarrassed, shall be subject to imprisonment for not longer than three years or a fine of not more than sixty thousand baht, or both.
Section 16. If the commission under paragraph one is a trustworthy action the perpetrator is not guilty.
Section 16. An offence under paragraph one shall be a compoundable offence.

Section 16. If a party injured by an offence under paragraph one has died before filing a complaint, then their parents, spouse or children may file a complaint and shall be deemed to be the injured party.

Section 17. Any person committing an offence against this Act outside the Kingdom and; (1) the offender is Thai and the government of the country where the offence has occurred or the injured party is required to be punished or;

Section 17. Any person committing an offence against this Act outside the Kingdom and; (2) the offender is a non-citizen and the Thai government or Thai person who is an injured party or the injured party is required to be punished; shall be penalized within the Kingdom.

Chapter 2
Competent Officials

Section 18. Within the power of Section 19 and for the benefit of an investigation, if there is reasonable cause to believe that there is the perpetration of an offence under this Act, then a relevant competent official shall have any of the following authorities only as necessary to identify a person who has committed an offence in order to: (1) issue an inquiry letter to any person related to the commission of an offence under this Act or summon them to give statements, forward written explanations or any other documents, data or evidence in an understandable form.

Section 18. Within the power of Section 19 and for the benefit of an investigation, if there is reasonable cause to believe that there is the perpetration of an offence under this Act, then a relevant competent official shall have any of the following authorities only as necessary to identify a person who has committed an offence in order to: (2) call for computer traffic data related to communications from a service user via a computer system or from other relevant persons.

Section 18. Within the power of Section 19 and for the benefit of an investigation, if there is reasonable cause to believe that there is the perpetration of an offence under this Act, then a relevant competent official shall have any of the following authorities only as necessary to identify a person who has committed an offence in order to: (3) instruct a service provider to deliver to a relevant competent official service usersrelated data that must be stored under Section 26 or that is in the possession or under the control of a service provider;

Section 18. Within the power of Section 19 and for the benefit of an investigation, if there is reasonable cause to believe that there is the perpetration of an offence under this Act, then a relevant competent official shall have any of the following authorities only as necessary to identify a person who has committed an offence in order to: (4) copy computer data, computer traffic data from a computer system, in which there is a reasonable cause to believe that offences under this Act have been committed if that computer is not yet in the possession of the competent official;

Section 18. Within the power of Section 19 and for the benefit of an investigation, if there is reasonable cause to believe that there is the perpetration of an offence under this Act, then a relevant competent official shall have any of the following authorities only as necessary to identify a person who has committed an offence in order to: (5) instruct a person who possesses or controls computer data or computer data storage equipment to deliver to the relevant competent official the computer data or the equipment pieces;

Section 18. Within the power of Section 19 and for the benefit of an investigation, if there is reasonable cause to believe that there is the perpetration of an offence under this Act, then a relevant competent official shall have any of the following authorities only as necessary to identify a person who has committed an offence in order to: (6) inspect or access a computer system, computer data, computer traffic data or computer data storage equipment belonging to any person that is evidence of, or may be used as evidence related to, the commission of an offence or used in identifying a person who has committed an offence, and instruct that person to send the relevant computer data to all necessary extent as well;

Section 18. Within the power of Section 19 and for the benefit of an investigation, if there is reasonable cause to believe that there is the perpetration of an offence under this Act, then a relevant competent official shall have any of the following authorities only as necessary to identify a person who has committed an offence in order to: (7) decode any person’s computer data or instruct any person related to the encryption of computer data to decode the computer data or cooperate with a relevant competent official in such decoding;

Section 18. Within the power of Section 19 and for the benefit of an investigation, if there is reasonable cause to believe that there is the perpetration of an offence under this Act, then a relevant competent official shall have any of the following authorities only as necessary to identify a person who has committed an offence in order to: (8) seize or attach the suspect computer system for the purpose of obtaining details of an offence and the person who has committed an offence under this Act;

Section 19. The power of authority of the relevant competent official under Section 18 (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8), is given when that competent official files a petition to a court with jurisdiction for an instruction to allow the relevant competent official to take action.

Section 19. However, the petition must identify a reasonable ground to believe that the offender is committing or going to commit an offence under the Act as well as the reason of requesting the authority, including the characteristics of the alleged offense, a description of the equipment used to commit the alleged offensive action and details of the offender, as much as this can be identified. The court should adjudicate urgently such aforementioned petition.

Section 19. When the court approves permission, and before taking any action according to the court’s instruction, the relevant competent official shall submit a copy of the reasonable ground memorandum to show that an authorization under Section 18 (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8), must be employed against the owner or possessor of the computer system, as evidence thereof. If there is no owner of such computer thereby, the relevant competent official should submit a copy of said memorandum as soon as possible.

Section 19. In order to take action under Section 18 (4), (5), (6), (7) and (8), the senior officer of the relevant competent official shall submit a copy of the memorandum about the description and rationale of the operation to a court with jurisdiction within forty eight (48) hours after the action has been taken as evidence thereof.

Section 19. When copying computer data under Section 18 (4), and given that it may be done only when there is a reasonable ground to believe that there is an offence against the Act, such action must not excessively interfere or obstruct the business operation of the computer data’s owner or possessor.

Section 19. Regarding seizure or attachment under Section 18 (8), a relevant competent official must issue a letter of seizure or attachment to the person who owns or possesses that computer system as evidence. This is provided, however, that the seizure or attachment shall not last longer than thirty days. If seizure or attachment requires a longer time period, a petition shall be filed at a court with jurisdiction for the extension of the seizure or attachment time period.
Section 19. The court may allow only one or several time extensions, however altogether for no longer than sixty days.

Section 19. When that seizure or attachment is no longer necessary, or upon its expiry date, the competent official must immediately return the computer system that was seized or withdraw the attachment.
Section 19. The letter of seizure or attachment under paragraph one shall be in accordance with a Ministerial Rule.

Section 20. If an offence under this Act is to disseminate computer data that might have an impact on the Kingdom’s security as stipulated in Division 2 type 1 or type 1/1 of the Criminal Code, or that it might be contradictory to the peace and concord or good morals of the people, the competent official appointed by the Minister may file a petition together with the evidence to a court with jurisdiction to restrain the dissemination of such computer data.

Section 20. If the court gives an instruction to restrain the dissemination of computer data according to paragraph one, the relevant competent official shall conduct the restraint either by himself or instruct the Service Provider to restrain the dissemination of such computer data.

Section 21. If a relevant competent official found that any computer data contains undesirable sets of instructions, a relevant competent official with the authority to prohibit the sale or dissemination of such, may instruct the person who owns or possesses the computer data to suspend the use of, destroy or correct the computer data therein, or to impose a condition with respect to the use, possession or dissemination of the undesirable sets of instructions.

Section 21. The undesirable sets of instructions under paragraph one shall mean to include sets of instructions that cause computer data, a computer system or other instruction sets to be damaged, destroyed, corrected, changed, added, interrupted or, fail to perform according to pre-determined instructions or otherwise as required by a relevant Ministerial Rule, with the exception of sets of instructions aimed at preventing or correcting the foregoing sets of instructions as required by a Minister and published in the Government Gazette.
Section 22. A relevant competent official shall not disclose or deliver computer data, computer traffic data or service users’ data acquired under Section 18 to any person.

Section 22. The provisions under paragraph one shall not apply to any actions performed for the benefit of lodging a lawsuit against a person who has committed an offence under this Act or for the benefit of lodging a lawsuit against a relevant competent official on the grounds of their abuse of authority or for action taken according to a court’s instruction or permission.
Section 22. Any competent official who violates paragraph one must be subject to imprisonment for no longer than three years or a fine of not more than sixty thousand baht, or both.

Section 23. Any competent official who commits an act of negligence that causes a third party to know of computer data, computer traffic data or a service user’s data acquired under Section 18 must be subject to imprisonment for no more than one year or a fine of not more than twenty thousand baht, or both.

Section 24. Any person knowing of computer data, computer traffic data or a service user’s data acquired by a relevant competent official under Section 18 and disclosing it to any person shall be subject to imprisonment for no longer than two years or a fine of not more than forty thousand baht, or both.

Section 25. Data, computer data or computer traffic data that the competent official acquired under this Act shall be admissible as evidence under the provision of the Criminal Procedure Code or other relevant law related to the investigation, however, it must not be in the way of influencing, promising, deceiving or other wrongful ways.

Section 26. A service provider must store computer traffic data for at least ninety days from the date on which the data is input into a computer system. However, if necessary, a relevant competent official may instruct a service provider to store data for a period of longer than ninety days but not exceeding one year on a special case by case basis or on a temporary basis.

Section 26. The service provider must keep the necessary information of the service user in order to be able to identify the service user from the beginning of the service provision, and such information must be kept for a further period not exceeding ninety days after the service agreement has been terminated.

Section 26. The types of service provider to whom the provisions under paragraph one shall apply and the timing of this application shall be established by a Minister and published in the Government Gazette.
Section 26. A service provider who fails to comply with this Section must be subject to a fine of not more than five hundred thousand baht.

Section 27. If any person fails to comply with the instructions of court or relevant competent official under Section 18 or Section 20 or fails to comply with the court’s instruction under Section 21 shall be subject to a fine of not more than two hundred thousand baht and a further daily fine of not more than five thousand baht until the relevant corrective action has been taken.

Section 28. Regarding the appointment of a competent official under this Act, the Minister shall appoint persons with knowledge of, and expertise in, computer systems and having the qualifications as required by the Minister.

Section 29. In performance of the duties under this Act, the competent official appointed by the Minister shall be an administrative officer or a senior police officer under the Criminal Procedure Code competent to receive a petition or accusation and be authorized to investigate only on an offence under this Act.

Section 29. In arresting, controlling, searching, investigating, and filing a lawsuit against a person who commits an offence under this Act, and for what is within the authority of an administrative officer or a senior police officer, such competent officer shall coordinate with the relevant investigating officer in charge to take action within their authorized duties.

Section 29. The Prime Minister is in charge of the Royal Thai Police Headquarters and with a Minister shall have a joint authority to establish a regulation with respect to the means and action-related procedures under paragraph two.
Section 30. In the performance of duties, a relevant competent official must produce an identity card to a relevant person.
Section 30. The identity card shall be as per the form required by a Minister and published in the Government Gazette.

LAW No. 1042 SPECIAL LAW ON CYBERCRIMES
Chapter I General Provisions

Article 1 Purpose: The present Law has as its purpose the prevention, investigation, prosecution and sanction of crimes committed by means of Information and Communication Technologies, to the detriment of natural or legal persons, as well as the comprehensive protection of systems that use such technologies, their content and any of their components, under the terms provided in this Law.
Article 2 Scope of application: The present Law is of public order and shall apply to those who commit the crimes provided for herein, inside or outside the national territory.
Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 1. Access to information systems: It is the entry to such systems, including remote accesses.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 2. Access to the information contained in a device that allows the storage of data: It is the reading, copying, extraction, modification or deletion of the information contained in such device.
Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 3. Copy of data: It is the total or partial reproduction of digital information.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 4. Cybercrimes: Actions or omissions, typical, unlawful, continuous or isolated, of a criminal nature, committed against natural and/or legal persons, using as a method, as a means or as an end, data, computer systems, Information and Communication Technologies and that have the object of injuring personal, patrimonial or computer legal goods of the victim.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 5. Computer data: It is any representation of facts, information or concepts in a digital or analog format, that can be generated, stored, processed or transmitted through Information and Communication Technologies.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 6. Traffic data: All data related to a communication made through any technological means, generated by the latter, that indicate origin, destination, route, time, date and type of service or protocol used, size and duration of the communication.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 7. Personal data: It is private information concerning a person, identified or identifiable, relating to his nationality, domicile, assets, electronic address, telephone number or similar.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 8. Sensitive personal data: It is all private information that reveals racial, ethnic origin, political affiliation, religious, philosophical or moral creed, union affiliation, relating to health or sexual life, criminal records or administrative offenses, economic-financial; as well as credit and financial information and any other information that may be a reason for discrimination.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 9. Device: It is any mechanism, instrument, apparatus, means that is used or can be used to execute any function of Information and Communication Technology.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 10. Data storage devices: It is any medium from which information is capable of being read, recorded, reproduced or transmitted with or without the aid of any other suitable means.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 11. Delivery of computer data and files: It is understood as the transfer of information, documents or data in electronic format held by private individuals, public or private entities.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 12. Computer identity: Information, data or any other characteristic that individualizes, identifies or distinguishes one person from another or one user from another user, within a computer system.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 13. Seizure and deposit of computer systems or data storage devices: It is understood as their physical occupation and securing by the competent authorities.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 14. Intercept: Action of appropriating or interrupting computer data contained or transmitted by means of Information and Communication Technologies before reaching their destination.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 15. Interfere: To obstruct, disturb or block by means of Information and Communication Technologies the computer systems, public or private.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 16. Interception of communications through Information and Communication Technologies: It is understood as the capture, listening or real-time recording of the content of such communications without interruption thereof, as well as traffic data.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 17. Child pornography: It comprises any representation of the image or voice of a child or adolescent performing sexual or erotic activities, implicit or explicit, real or simulated, as well as the exposure of their genital parts, for sexual purposes, by any means whether direct, mechanical, digital, audiovisual, or with computer, electronic or other type of support.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 18. Person with a disability in need of special protection: That person with a disability who, whether or not judicially modified in their capacity to act, requires assistance or support for the exercise of their legal capacity and for decision-making regarding their person, their rights or interests due to their intellectual or mental limitations of a temporary or permanent nature.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 19. Service provider: It is the natural or legal person, public or private, that supplies users with communication services, computer security, data processing or storage, through Information and Communication Technologies.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 20. Computer program: It is the tool or instrument developed in a computer language that executes a sequence of processes in a computer system.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 21. Immediate preservation requirement of data held by third parties: It is understood as the imposition on Natural or Legal Persons of the duty of integral conservation of the digital information in their possession or over which they have powers of disposal.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 22. Sealing, sealing-off and prohibition of use of computer systems or data storage devices: It is understood as their blocking or the impossibility of their use while preserving the integrity of their content.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 23. Computer system: Any device isolated, connected or related to other devices by communication links or the technology that in the future replaces it, whose function, or that of any of its elements, is the automated processing of data in execution of a computer program.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 24. Smart card: Any electronic device that allows the execution of certain programmed logic for the storage of information and/or data, which is used as an instrument of identification or access to a system, to carry out electronic procedures by the authorized holder.

Article 3 Definitions — For the purposes of this Law the following shall be understood: 25. Information and Communication Technologies: Set of means of communication and information applications that allow the capture, production, reproduction, transmission, storage, processing, treatment, and presentation of information, in the form of images, voice, texts, codes or data contained in signals of an acoustic, optical or electromagnetic nature, among others, by means of communication, transmission and reception protocols.
Chapter II Crimes Related to the Integrity of Computer Systems

Article 4 Unauthorized access to computer systems: Whoever intentionally and without authorization or exceeding that which had been granted to him, accesses, intercepts or makes partial or total use of a computer system that uses Information and Communication Technologies, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to three years and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 5 Unauthorized access to computer programs or data: Whoever knowingly and with the intention of using any Information Technology device, directly or indirectly, partially or totally, accessed any program or the data stored in it, for the purpose of appropriating them or committing another crime with them, shall be punished with imprisonment of two to four years and three hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 5 — The penalties for the conducts described in Articles 4 and 5 shall be increased by one third in their lower and upper limits when they are committed for commercial purposes or against: 1. Public offices or under their tutelage.

Article 5 — The penalties for the conducts described in Articles 4 and 5 shall be increased by one third in their lower and upper limits when they are committed for commercial purposes or against: 2. Public, private or mixed institutions that provide a public service.

Article 5 — The penalties for the conducts described in Articles 4 and 5 shall be increased by one third in their lower and upper limits when they are committed for commercial purposes or against: 3. Banks, microfinance institutions, general warehouses of deposits, financial groups, insurance companies and other financial and stock institutions supervised and/or regulated in Nicaragua.

Article 6 Interception of communications and transmissions between systems of Information and Communication Technologies: The person who illegitimately intercepts any type of written communication not addressed to him, or who, using Information and Communication Technologies, intercepts any transmission to, from or within a computer system or any technological means that is not available to the public; or the electromagnetic emissions that are carrying data from a computer system, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to three years and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 7 Improper capture of others' communications through Information and Communication Technologies: Whoever illegitimately, using Information and Communication Technologies, or any other means, records or captures the words or conversations of others, whether these are video, images, codes, audio or text, not intended for the public, listens to or intervenes in private communications that are not addressed to him, shall be punished with imprisonment of one to three years and one hundred to three hundred days fine.

Article 8 Interference with the computer system or data: Whoever intentionally and by any means interferes or alters the functioning of a computer system or the data contained therein, temporarily or permanently, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years and two hundred to four hundred days fine.

Article 8 — If the aforementioned conduct affects the computer systems of the State, or those intended for the provision of health, communications, financial, energy, water supply, means of transport, ports and airports, citizen security, social security system, education in any of its subsystems and national defense or others of public service, the prison sentence shall be four to six years and three hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 9 Alteration, damage to the integrity and availability of data: Whoever, violating the security of a computer system, destroys, alters, duplicates, disables or damages the information, data or processes, in regard to their integrity, availability and confidentiality in any of their states of entry, processing, transmission or storage, shall be punished with imprisonment of four to six years and three hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 10 Damage to computer systems — Article 10 Damage to computer systems: Whoever destroys, damages, modifies, executes a program or performs any act that alters the functioning or disables partially or totally a computer system that uses Information and Communication Technologies or any of the physical or logical components that integrate it, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to five years and three hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 10 Damage to computer systems — Article 10 Damage to computer systems: If the offense provided in the preceding paragraph is committed through negligence it shall be punished with two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 10 Damage to computer systems — Article 10 Damage to computer systems: If the offense provided in this article falls against any of the components of a computer system that use Information and Communication Technologies, that are intended for the provision of public or financial services, or that contain personal data, sensitive personal data, reserved public information, technical or proprietary information of natural or legal persons, the prison sentence shall be four to six years and three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 10 Damage to computer systems — Article 10 Damage to computer systems: If the action provided in the preceding paragraph is committed through negligence it shall be punished with three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 11 Possession of equipment or provision of services to breach computer security: Whoever possesses, produces, facilitates, adapts, imports, sells equipment, devices, computer programs, passwords or access codes with the purpose of breaching, illegitimately eliminating the security of any computer system, offers or provides services intended to accomplish the same ends to commit any of the crimes established in the present Law, shall be punished with imprisonment of four to six years and three hundred to six hundred days fine.
Chapter III Computer Crimes

Article 12 Computer fraud: Whoever by means of improper use of Information and Communication Technologies, making use of any manipulation of computer systems or any of their components, computer data or information contained therein, succeeds in inserting false or fraudulent instructions that produce a result that allows obtaining a gain for himself or for a third party to the detriment of another, shall be punished with imprisonment of three to six years and three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 13 Computer espionage: Whoever improperly obtains sensitive personal data or reserved public information contained in a system that uses Information and Communication Technologies or in any of its components, shall be punished with imprisonment of five to eight years and three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 13 — If any of the conducts described above are committed with the aim of obtaining benefit for oneself or another, endanger the sovereign security of the State, the reliability of the operation of the affected institutions or result in some harm to natural or legal persons as a consequence of the revelation of public information classified as reserved in accordance with the law of the matter, the penalty shall be six to ten years imprisonment and three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 14 Violation of computer system security: The person who without possessing the corresponding authorization transgresses the security of a restricted or protected computer system, shall be punished with imprisonment of two to five years and three hundred to six hundred days fine.
Article 14 — The same sanction shall be imposed on whoever induces a third party so that involuntarily performs the conduct described in the previous paragraph.

Article 15 Theft by computer means: Whoever, by means of the use of Information and Communication Technologies, takes possession of tangible or intangible patrimonial goods or values, removing them from their owner, holder or possessor, with the aim of obtaining an economic benefit for himself or for another, provided that the value of what was stolen is greater than the sum resulting from two monthly minimum wages of the industrial sector, shall be punished with imprisonment of two to five years and three hundred to six hundred days fine.
Chapter IV Computer Crimes Related to the Content of Data

Article 16 Manipulation of records: Whoever, abusing his administrative functions of technological platforms, public or private, disables, alters, hides, destroys, or renders in whole or in part any information, data contained in an access or use register of their components, shall be imposed a sentence of five to eight years imprisonment and three hundred to six hundred days fine.
Article 16 — If the conducts described above favor the commission of another crime by a third party, the penalty shall be aggravated up to one third in its lower and upper limit.

Article 17 Fraudulent manipulation of smart cards or similar instruments: Whoever intentionally and without due authorization by any means creates, captures, records, copies, alters, duplicates, clones or deletes computer data contained in a smart card or in any instrument intended for the same purposes; with the object of incorporating, modifying users, accounts, unrecognized consumptions, shall be imposed a sentence of five to eight years imprisonment and three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 18 Improper obtaining of goods or services by means of smart cards or similar means: Whoever without authorization, using Information and Communication Technologies, uses another's smart card or instrument intended for the same purposes, for the obtaining of any good or service or to provide its payment without disbursing or assuming the payment obligation of the due consideration obtained, shall be imposed a sentence of five to eight years imprisonment and three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 19 Improper provision of goods or services: Whoever knowing that a smart card or instrument intended for the same purposes is expired, revoked, has been improperly obtained, retained, falsified or altered; provides to the person who presents them money, effects, goods or services, or any other thing of economic value shall be imposed a sentence of five to eight years imprisonment and three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 20 Violation of judicial custody of data: Whoever knowing that a computer system or any of its components is under judicial custody and uses them, manipulates its records or contents, violates seals or seals-offs, shall be imposed a penalty of one to four years imprisonment.

Article 20 — If the action described in the preceding paragraph is carried out, facilitated or permitted by the person in charge of the judicial custody, he shall be imposed a penalty of two to five years imprisonment.

Article 21 Breach of confidentiality: Whoever breaches confidentiality about the information that he learned on the occasion of his participation in the process of investigation, collection, interception or intervention of data of a computer system or its components, shall be imposed a penalty of one hundred to three hundred days fine.

Article 22 Impersonation and appropriation of computer identity: Whoever impersonates or takes over the computer identity of a natural or legal person by means of Information and Communication Technologies, shall be imposed a penalty of three to five years imprisonment and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 22 — If with the conducts described in the previous paragraph he harms, extorts, defrauds, insults or threatens another person to cause harm or obtain benefits for himself or for third parties, he shall be imposed a penalty of five to eight years imprisonment and three hundred to six hundred days fine.

Article 23 Unauthorized disclosure: Whoever without authorization makes known a code, password or any other means of access to a program, information or data stored in equipment or technological device, with the purpose of profiting himself, a third party or to commit a crime, shall be imposed a penalty of five to eight years imprisonment and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 24 Use of personal data: Whoever without authorization uses personal data through the use of Information and Communication Technologies, violating confidentiality and data security systems, inserting or modifying data to the detriment of a third party, shall be imposed a penalty of four to six years imprisonment and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 24 — The penalty shall increase up to one third of the upper limit of the penalty provided in the preceding paragraph to whoever provides or reveals to another information registered in a file or in a personal data bank whose secrecy he is obliged to preserve.

Article 25 Transfer of reserved public information: Whoever without authorization or exceeding that which had been granted to him, transfers Public information classified as reserved, in accordance with the law on the matter and that by using that information undermines a system or computer data or endangers the sovereign security of the State, relying on any kind of Information and Communication Technologies, shall be imposed a penalty of five to eight years imprisonment and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 26 Improper disclosure of personal data or information of a personal nature: Whoever without the consent of the holder of the private and personal information reveals, disseminates or transfers in whole or in part, such information or data, whether in images, video, text, audio or others, obtained by means of Information and Communication Technologies, shall be imposed a penalty of three to six years imprisonment and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 26 — If any of the conducts described in the preceding paragraph had been carried out for profit, facilitate the commission of another crime or explicit sexual material is disseminated to the detriment of a third party, he shall be imposed a penalty of four to eight years imprisonment and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 26 — The maximum limit of the penalty of the preceding paragraph shall be imposed, increased up to one third, if any of the conducts described in the present article falls on sensitive personal data.

Article 27 Computer impersonation in commercial acts: Whoever without authorization and in the name of a third party, by means of Information and Communication Technologies, sells or markets goods or services, impersonating the identity of the authorized producer, provider or distributor, shall be imposed a penalty of three to five years imprisonment and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 27 — The conduct described in the preceding paragraph shall be aggravated with imprisonment of four to six years, when the sale or marketing concerns medicines, supplements or food products, beverages or any product for human consumption.

Article 28 Threats through Information and Communication Technologies — Whoever threatens another through the use of Information and Communication Technologies with: 1. Causing to him, his family or other persons related to him, a harm that constitutes a crime and that by its nature seems plausible, shall be imposed a penalty of one to three years imprisonment.

Article 28 Threats through Information and Communication Technologies — Whoever threatens another through the use of Information and Communication Technologies with: 2. Making imputations against honor, or prestige, violating or disclosing secrets, to the detriment of him, his family, other persons related to him, or an entity he represents or in which he has interest, shall be imposed a penalty of two to four years imprisonment.
Article 28 — If the threat is made in the name of entities or real or supposed groups, a penalty of three to five years imprisonment shall be imposed.

Article 28 — If the threat of a harm that constitutes a crime were directed to intimidate the inhabitants of a population, ethnic, cultural or religious group, social collective or any other group of people and they had the necessary capacity to achieve it, a penalty of four to six years imprisonment shall be imposed.

Article 29 Provocation, apology and inducement to commit crimes through Information and Communication Technologies: Whoever, using Information and Communication Technologies, incites, instigates, provokes or promotes the commission of crimes, praises crime or exalts its author or participants or claims it, shall be imposed a penalty of three to five years imprisonment and two hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 30 Propagation of false news through Information and Communication Technologies: Whoever, using Information and Communication Technologies, publishes or disseminates false and/or distorted information, that produces alarm, fear, unrest in the population, or to a group or sector of it or a person or his family, shall be imposed a penalty of two to four years imprisonment and three hundred to five hundred days fine.

Article 30 — If the publication or dissemination of false and/or distorted information harms the honor, prestige or reputation of a person or his family, a penalty of one to three years imprisonment and one hundred fifty to three hundred fifty days fine shall be imposed.

Article 30 — If the publication or dissemination of false and/or distorted information incites hatred and violence, endangers economic stability, public order, public health or sovereign security, a penalty of three to five years imprisonment and five hundred to eight hundred days fine shall be imposed.
Chapter V Computer Crimes Related to Sexual Freedom and Integrity

Article 31 Use of girls, boys, adolescents or persons with disabilities in need of special protection in pornography through the use of Information and Communication Technologies: Whoever, by means of the use of Information and Communication Technologies, induces, facilitates, promotes, uses, abuses or exploits for sexual or erotic purposes girls, boys, adolescents or persons with disabilities in need of special protection, making them witness or participate in a behavior, spectacle or public or private sexual act, shall be imposed a penalty of five to eight years imprisonment and three hundred to six hundred days fine.
Article 31 — No value is recognized, in any of the cases described in the preceding paragraph, to the consent of the victim.

Article 32 Corruption of persons under 16 years of age or persons with disabilities in need of special protection through the use of Information and Communication Technologies: Any person over 18 years who makes implicit or explicit proposals to persons under 16 years of age or persons with disabilities in need of special protection to hold sexual or erotic encounters, or for the production of pornography through the use of Information and Communication Technologies for himself or for third parties, shall be imposed a penalty of one to three years imprisonment.

Article 33 Harassment through the use of Information and Communication Technologies: Whoever torments, harasses, humiliates, insults, denigrates or other types of conduct that affect psychological or emotional stability, endangers life or physical integrity, by means of the use of Information and Communication Technologies, shall be imposed a penalty of two to four years imprisonment.
Article 33 — When the victim is a girl, boy, adolescent or person with a disability in need of special protection, a penalty of four to six years imprisonment shall be imposed.

Article 34 Sexual harassment through the use of Information and Communication Technologies: When an adult sends messages, phrases, photographs, videos or another unequivocal action of a sexual nature or content to another person without his consent through the use of Information and Communication Technologies he shall be imposed a penalty of two to four years imprisonment.

Article 34 — When the victim is under 16 years of age, with or without his consent or a person with a disability in need of special protection he shall be imposed a penalty of four to six years imprisonment.

Article 35 Common aggravating conditions: The crimes referred to in Articles 31, 32, 33 and 34 shall be sanctioned with the corresponding maximum penalty, increased up to one third of the maximum established penalty and the disqualification from exercising his profession during the time that the sentence lasts, if any of the actions described were carried out by: 1. Ascendants, descendants, siblings, spouses, cohabitants and relatives up to the fourth degree of consanguinity and second of affinity;

Article 35 Common aggravating conditions: The crimes referred to in Articles 31, 32, 33 and 34 shall be sanctioned with the corresponding maximum penalty, increased up to one third of the maximum established penalty and the disqualification from exercising his profession during the time that the sentence lasts, if any of the actions described were carried out by: 2. Authority, officials and public employees;

Article 35 Common aggravating conditions: The crimes referred to in Articles 31, 32, 33 and 34 shall be sanctioned with the corresponding maximum penalty, increased up to one third of the maximum established penalty and the disqualification from exercising his profession during the time that the sentence lasts, if any of the actions described were carried out by: 3. The person in charge of the guardianship, protection or surveillance of the victim; and

Article 35 Common aggravating conditions: The crimes referred to in Articles 31, 32, 33 and 34 shall be sanctioned with the corresponding maximum penalty, increased up to one third of the maximum established penalty and the disqualification from exercising his profession during the time that the sentence lasts, if any of the actions described were carried out by: 4. Any person who taking advantage of superiority originated by relationships of trust, educational, work or any other relationship.
Chapter VI Procedure, Precautionary and Procedural Measures

Article 36 Investigation, obtaining and preservation of data: In the investigation, obtaining and preservation of the data contained in an information system or its components, traffic data, connection, access or any other useful information, the provisions of the present Law shall apply.

Article 37 Data preservation: The National Police or the Public Ministry, within the scope of their competence, shall act with the required speed to preserve the data contained in an information system or its components, or the traffic data of the system, mainly when these are vulnerable to loss or modification.

Article 38 Precautionary measures — Without prejudice to any other precautionary measures that could contribute to the effective prosecution of the crimes included within the scope of application of this Law, the following specific measures may be requested: 1. The seizure and deposit of computer systems or data storage devices.

Article 38 Precautionary measures — Without prejudice to any other precautionary measures that could contribute to the effective prosecution of the crimes included within the scope of application of this Law, the following specific measures may be requested: 2. The sealing, sealing-off and prohibition of use of computer systems or data storage devices.

Article 38 Precautionary measures — Without prejudice to any other precautionary measures that could contribute to the effective prosecution of the crimes included within the scope of application of this Law, the following specific measures may be requested: 3. The immediate preservation requirement of data that are in the possession of third parties.

Article 38 Precautionary measures — Without prejudice to any other precautionary measures that could contribute to the effective prosecution of the crimes included within the scope of application of this Law, the following specific measures may be requested: 4. The copy of data.

Article 39 Request for judicial authorization: In the investigation stage for obtaining and conserving the information contained in computer systems or any of their components, judicial authorization shall be required from any District Criminal Judge, at a duly substantiated request by the National Police or the Public Ministry. Once the process has been initiated, any of the parties may request the authorization from the Judge of the case.
Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 1. Order a natural or legal person the immediate delivery of the information that is in an information system or in any of its components;

Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 2. Order a natural or legal person to preserve and maintain the integrity of an information system or any of its components, to conserve traffic, connection, access data or any other information that is in his possession or under his control and that may be of use to the investigation, for a period of up to ninety (90) days, this order may be renewed once for the same period;
Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 3. Order access to said information system or to any of its components;
Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 4. Order a service provider to supply information of the data relating to a user that it may have in its possession or control;
Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 5. Seize or secure an information system or any of its components, in whole or in part;
Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 6. Make and retain a copy of the content of the information system or any of its components;
Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 7. Order the maintenance of the integrity of the content of an information system or any of its components;
Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 8. Make inaccessible or remove the content of an information system or any of its components, that has been accessed for the investigation;

Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 9. Order the person who has knowledge about the functioning of an information system or any of its components or about the data protection measures in said system, to provide the information necessary to carry out the corresponding investigations;

Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 10. Order the extraction, collection or recording of data from an information system or any of its components, through the application of technological measures;

Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 11. Order the service provider to collect, extract or record the data relating to a user, as well as real-time data traffic, through the application of technological measures;

Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 12. Carry out the interception or interception of telecommunications in real time, according to the procedure established in article 62 of Law No. 735, Law on Prevention, Investigation and Prosecution of Organized Crime and Administration of Seized, Forfeited and Abandoned Assets, which shall be applicable to the crimes contained in the present Law;
Article 39 — For this purpose, the Judge may: 13. Order any other measure applicable to an information system or its components to obtain the necessary data and ensure their preservation.
Article 39 — If the authorization is decreed after the Preliminary or Initial Hearing, as appropriate, the defender must be notified and shall have the right to be present in the practice of the act.
Article 39 — In urgent cases to carry out the act of investigation, procedure shall be followed in accordance with Article 246 of the Code of Criminal Procedure.

Article 40 Subject-matter jurisdiction: In the crimes related in Chapter V "Computer Crimes related to Sexual Freedom and Integrity" of the present Law, when they are committed against women, girls, boys or adolescents or persons with disabilities in need of special protection, the specialized District Courts in violence shall be competent to hear and resolve in first instance.

Article 41 Responsibility of the judicial custodian of computer systems: Whoever has been entrusted with the preservation of the computer system or any of its components, as well as its content, shall preserve their confidentiality and integrity, preventing third parties, other than the competent authorities, from having access and knowledge of them.
Article 41 — Likewise, the person in charge of custody may not use the information system or any of its components in custody for purposes other than those concerning the investigative process.

Article 42 Confidentiality of the investigative process: Those who participate in the process of investigation, collection, interception, intervention of data of an information system or its components, shall maintain confidentiality of all the information that they become aware of about the execution of the acts carried out by the competent authority.
Chapter VII International Cooperation

Article 43 Extradition: For purposes of extradition related to the commission of the crimes typified in the present Law, in the absence of Treaties or International Conventions to which the Republic of Nicaragua is a State party, the conditions, procedure and effects of extradition shall be determined by the provisions of Law No. 406, Code of Criminal Procedure, which shall also apply to aspects that have not been provided for by the respective Treaty or Convention.

Article 44 Mutual legal assistance: The competent authorities of the Republic of Nicaragua may provide or request international cooperation or mutual legal assistance, in the investigations and processes related to the application of the present Law, in accordance with the Conventions or International Treaties in which Nicaragua is a State party.

Article 44 — In the absence of an International Convention or Treaty, mutual legal assistance may be provided or requested on the basis of the principle of reciprocity established in International Law.
Chapter VIII Final Provisions

Article 45 Subsidiarity: That which is not provided for in this Law, shall be regulated by the provisions of Law No. 641, Penal Code, Law No. 406, Code of Criminal Procedure of the Republic of Nicaragua, Law No. 735, Law on Prevention, Investigation and Prosecution of Organized Crime and the Administration of Seized, Forfeited and Abandoned Assets; Decree No. 70-2010, Regulation of Law No. 735, Law on Prevention, Investigation and Prosecution of Organized Crime and the Administration of Seized, Forfeited and Abandoned Assets; Law No. 779, Comprehensive Law against Violence toward Women and amendment to Law No. 641 Penal Code; and Law No. 787, Law on Protection of Personal Data, insofar as applicable to guarantee the effective compliance with this Law.

Article 46 Issuance of regulations for the preservation of computer data: The Nicaraguan Institute of Telecommunications and Posts (TELCOR), shall issue regulations for the preservation of data and information by service providers, within a period of 3 months from the publication of this Law in La Gaceta, Official Gazette.

Article 47 Repeals: Articles 192, 193, 194, 198, 245, 246 of Law No. 641, Penal Code, published in La Gaceta, Official Gazette No. 83, 84, 85, 86 and 87 of May 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9, 2008, are hereby repealed.
Article 48 Publication and entry into force: The present Law shall enter into force 60 days after its publication in La Gaceta, Official Gazette.

Final enactment clause: Given in the city of Managua, in the Session Hall of the National Assembly on the twenty-seventh day of October of the year two thousand twenty. MSP. Loria Raquel Dixon Brautigam, First Secretary of the National Assembly.

Final enactment clause: Therefore. Be it considered as Law of the Republic. Publish and Execute. Managua, the twenty-eighth day of October of the year two thousand twenty. Daniel Ortega Saavedra, President of the Republic of Nicaragua.

Statutory Instrument 76 of 2020. [CAP. 10:06 Civil Protection (Declaration of State of Disaster: Rural and Urban Areas of Zimbabwe) (COVID-19) Notice, 2020 IN terms of section 27(2) of the Civil Protection Act [Chapter 10:06], His Excellency the President hereby declares as follows: — Title 1. This notice may be cited as the Civil Protection (Declaration of State of Disaster: Rural and UrbanAreas of Zimbabwe) (COVID-19) Notice, 2020.

Interpretation 2. In this notice — "COVID-19" means the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCov), which is an infectious disease caused by a virus which, having emerged during 2019, was declared a global pandemic by the World Health Organisation on the 11th March, 2020;
2. In this notice — "urban area" means any area which is — (a) a municipal area, town area or local government area;

2. In this notice — "urban area" means any area which is — (b) a town ward of a rural district council or an area declared to be a specified area in terms of the Rural District Councils Act [Chapter 29:13] ',
2. In this notice — "urban area" means any area which is — (c) a township as defined in the Land Survey Act [Chapter 20:12]','

Declaration of state of disaster 3. In the wake of the declaration by the World Health Organisation of COVID-19 as a global pandemic, a state of disaster exists in all rural and urban areas in Zimbabwe with effect from promulgation of this notice.

Statutory Instrument 77 of 2020. [CAP. 15:17 Public Health (COVID-19 Prevention, Containment and Treatment) Regulations, 2020 ARRANGEMENT OF SECTIONS Section 1. Title. 2. Interpretation. 3.
