T he magistrate, judicial o r p ublic prosecutor, or the arbitrator who prevaricates i n t he r esolution o f a matter of justice, d eciding or promoting a gainst the l aw, with the intention o f securing a gain for the perpetrator, preventing, frustrating or deceiving, in whole or in part, the activity o f the competent judicial bodies, shall be punished with imprisonment of 1 t o 5 y ears.
2. I f t he m isconduct takes p lace i n a criminal proceeding a nd results in the d eprivation o f liberty o r t he c ontinued d eprivation of liberty o f a p erson, t he prison sentence i s 2 to 10 years.
3. T he public s ervant who, in a ny process, including disciplinary proceedings, illegally promotes or fails to promote, decides or fails to decide and, in general, performs or fails to perform an act inherent in the exercise of his or her functions is punished with a prison sentence o f up t o 3 years o r a fine of up t o 360 days.

ARTICLE 350 (False testimony, d eclaration, expert o pinion or t ranslation)
1. W hoever, b efore the C ourt or a n o fficial c ompetent t o r eceive testimony as evidence, gives t estimony or a declaration that he knows to be false s hall b e p unished with imprisonment of 6 months to 3 years or a fine of 60 to 360 d ays.
2. A nyone w ho makes a false statement o r t estimony, is subject to a legal oath and has s worn i t, shall be p unished with the same penalty i ncreased b y a quarter o f its m inimum and maximum l imits.
3. T he p enalty established i n paragraph 1 shall a pply t o: a) The defendant who makes f alse statements a bout h is identity or background criminal; b) A nyone w ho, w ithout just cause, refuses to testify, make statements o r p resent a report, information or translation, w hen their provision or presentation is mandatory.
4. T he p rovisions o f p aragraph 1 d o n ot a pply to s tatements m ade b y the defendant r egarding t he facts t hat are t he subject o f t he proceedings and that a re imputed to h im.

ARTICLE 351 (Personal favoritism)
1. W hoever, a fter committing a crime, p rovides a ssistance t o the perpetrator, preventing, frustrating or deceiving, in whole o r in part, t he activity o f the competent judicial bodies, so t hat the perpetrator escapes t he a ction o f justice, t he application of c riminal sanctions or t heir execution, shall b e punished with a prison s entence of up t o 3 years or a fine of up t o 360 days.
2. The penalty t o which the agent is s entenced may never be higher than t hat provided for b y l aw for t he c rime committed.
3. The following a re not punishable: a) The agent who, with the assistance provided, seeks to prevent a criminal sanction from b eing applied or executed a gainst him; b) The spouse, ascendants or descendants, the adoptive parents, third degree of the collateral line of the person to whom is they provided assistance and, also, whoever lives with this person in a situation similar to that of spouses.

ARTICLE 352 (Slanderous d enunciation)
1. Whoever, b y a ny means, before a n authority or p ublicly, denounces or c asts s uspicion on a c ertain person o f having committed a crime, k nowing t hat t he a ccusation is f alse a nd intending to i nstitute criminal p roceedings a gainst him/her, s hall b e p unished w ith a prison s entence of 1 t o 3 y ears or a f ine of 120 to 360 days.

ARTICLE 353 (Subtraction or diversion o f process o r evidentiary documents)
1. Whoever subtracts, destroys, conceals, fails t o return o r misappropriates a judicial p rocess, a r egistration b ook, o r part thereof, or a d ocument r elating thereto, or a d ocument o r evidentiary object received b y r eason o f t heir duties, s hall b e p unished with a p rison s entence o f 1 to 3 y ears or a f ine of 120 to 360 days.
2. If t he f act referred t o in t he p revious n umber results in con- demnation, deprivation of liberty of any person or its maintenance, the penalty is i mprisonment o f 2 t o 8 y ears.
3. If t he o ffender i s a l awyer, magistrate, judicial officer o r Public Prosecutor, the p enalty is i mprisonment o f 2 t o 6 y ears, i n t he case o f no. 1, and 3 to 1 0 y ears, i n t he c ase o f no. 2.

ARTICLE 354 (Obstruction o f justice)
1. T he public official who i llegitimately prevents or detains or arrests a person is punished with a p rison s entence o f up to 2 years or a fine of up to 240 days.
2. A nyone who r esorts t o physical f orce, threats, intimidation or the promise, offer o r g ranting o f an u ndue b enefit, w ith t he intention to prevent testimony or the presentation of evidence in a criminal proceeding is punishable by 2 to 4 years i n prison.
3. Anyone who resorts t o the means listed s hall i ncur t he same penalty.

ARTICLE 355 (Violation o f judicial s ecrecy)
Anyone w ho d iscloses acts, f acts o r t he content o f documents i n a case p rotected b y judicial secrecy o r t o which the Procedural L aw or the judge d oes n ot allow public a ccess shall b e punished with a prison s entence of up t o 3 years o r a fine of up t o 360 d ays.
CHAPTER IV Crimes Committed i n the Exercise o f Public F unctions and t o the Detriment o f Public F unctions

ARTICLE 356 (Violation o f confidentiality by e mployee)
1. A person who, by the nature of their activity, is bound by the duty of confidentiality, and who, aware that he or she is endangering the public interest or that of a third party or with the intention of obtaining a benefit for himself or another person, reveals such knowledge in the exercise of his/her position or function is punishable by imprisonment of 1 to 5 years.
2. I n case o f n egligence, the p enalty is i mprisonment f or up t o 1 year or a f ine o f up t o 1 20 days.
3. C riminal proceedings depend on the p articipation of the entity responsible for t he s ervice o r a complaint f rom t he o ffended p arty.

ARTICLE 357 (Undue r eceipt o f advantage)
1. A public official who, in the exercise of his duties or because of them, personally or through an intermediary, with himself or a third party, a patrimonial or non-patrimonial advantage that is not due to him, is punished with a prison sentence of 1 to 5 years.
2. Whoever, by himself or through an intermediary, with his employee or to a third party, by indication or knowledge of the latter, requests or accepts a financial or non-financial advantage that is not due to him, in the exercise of his functions or because of them, is punished with a prison sentence of 6 months to 3 years or a fine of 60 to 360 days.
3. If the offer, gift or promise of an advantage is intended for the commission of a criminal offense, the penalty is 3 to 7 years in prison.
4. If the unlawful act is committed, the perpetrator shall be punished with imprisonment of 3 to 10 years, if a more severe penalty is not applicable under another criminal law.

ARTICLE 358 (Active corruption o f an o fficial)
1. Whoever, by himself or through an intermediary, with his patrimonial or non-patrimonial advantage to an employee or person specifically obliged to provide a public service, or to a third person with their knowledge, to perform an act or omission inherent to the duties of the respective position or function, is punished with a prison sentence of up to 2 years or a fine of up to 240 days.
2. If, in the case of the previous number, the act or omission is contrary to the duties of the position or function, the penalty is imprisonment of up to 3 years or a fine of up to 360 days.
3. If the unlawful act referred to in the previous paragraph is committed, the perpetrator shall be punished with imprisonment of 3 to 10 years, if a more severe penalty is not applicable under another criminal law.
4. Offers, gifts or promises made to an employee or person specifically obliged to provide a public service that are socially appropriate and in accordance with customs and practices are not relevant for the purposes of this article.
5. The agent is exempt from punishment whenever he withdraws the promise, refuses to offer the advantage or requests its return before committing the act.
6. The penalties provided for in the previous numbers are particularly mitigated when: a) The agent committed the act at the request of the employee, directly or through an intermediary. b) The offender reports the crime within a maximum period of 90 days after the act was committed and always before criminal proceedings are instituted; c) The agent specifically assists in obtaining or producing the structure or capture of other responsible parties.
7. The provisions of the following shall apply, with due adaptations: Nos. 5, 6 and 7 of Article 358 and No. 5 of Article 359.

ARTICLE 359 (Passive c orruption of a n e mployee)
1. A ny e mployee who, personally o r through an intermediary with his/her consent, requests or accepts, for himself/herself or for a third party, a financial or non-financial advantage, or the promise thereof, t o p erform a n a ct or omission i nherent t o the d uties o f t he position or function, even if prior t o that request or acceptance, shall be punished with a prison sentence o f up t o 2 y ears or a fine o f u p t o 240 days.
2. If, in the case of the previous number, the act or omission is contrary to the duties of the position or function, the penalty is imprisonment of up to 3 years or a fine of up to 360 days.
3. If the request, demand or acceptance is intended to commit an unlawful act or act contrary to the duties of the position or function, it shall be punished with imprisonment of 3 to 10 years.
4. The penalties provided for in the previous paragraphs are increased by a third, in their maximum and minimum limits, when the agent holds a political office.

ARTICLE 360 (Active c orruption of a m agistrate or arbitrator)
1. Whoever offers, promises or grants, personally or through an intermediary with their consent, a financial or non-financial advantage that is not due to a Judicial Magistrate, Public Prosecutor or arbitrator to perform or for having performed an act inherent to their position or function, shall be punished with imprisonment o f up t o 5 y ears.
2. If the offer, promise or granting of an advantage has been intended to commit an unlawful act, the penalty is imprisonment of 3 to 12 years, if a more severe penalty is not applicable by virtue of another criminal provision.
3. The penalties provided for in the previous numbers are increased by one third, in their maximum and minimum limits, when the agent holds a political office.

ARTICLE 361 (Passive corruption o f a m agistrate or arbitrator)
1. A judicial magistrate, member of the Public Prosecutor's Office or arbitrator who requests, demands or accepts, for himself or for a third party, a promise of an advantage or an advantage that is not due to him or her to perform or not to perform, whether or not he or she has actually performed an act inherent to his or her position or function, even if prior to that request, demand or acceptance, shall be punished with a prison sentence of 1 to 5 years.
2. If the request, demand or acceptance of a promise or advantage is intended to commit a criminal offense, the penalty is imprisonment of 3 to 7 years.
3. If the unlawful act is committed, the penalty is imprisonment of 5 to 16 years.

ARTICLE 362 (Embezzlement)
1. A public official who illegitimately appropriates, for his own benefit or that of another, money or movable property that does not belong to him and has been handed over to him, is in his possession or to which he has access by virtue of his position or duties shall be punished, according to the value of the movable property or money appropriated, with the following penalties:
a) Imprisonment of 1 to 5 years, if the value of the appropriated item is not high; b) Imprisonment of 3 to 10 years, if the value of the appropriated item is high; c) Imprisonment of 5 to 14 years, if the value of the appropriated item is considerably high.
2. The penalties provided for in the previous paragraph are increased by one third, in their minimum and maximum limits, when the agent holds a political office.

ARTICLE 363 (Embezzlement of u se)
1. A public servant who uses or allows the use of money or movable property that does not belong to him and has been handed over to him, is in his possession or to which he has access through those for whom the thing is intended is punished with imprisonment of up to 5 years.
2. I f, i n t he c ase o f public m oney, the a gent gives it a public use other than that for which it was intended without being legally required, he shall be punished with imprisonment of up to 3 years or a fine of up to 360 days.
3. Embezzlement of use is not punishable when the money or movable property used is not of high value, under the terms of paragraph b) of article 3 91.

ARTICLE 364 (Economic participation i n b usiness)
1. An employee who, w ith t he i ntention of o btaining a n advantage that i s not d ue, p articipates i n a legal t ransaction i nvolving f inancial interests that, i n w hole o r i n p art, a re his r esponsibility, by virtue of his position or duties, is punishable with imprisonment of up t o 5 years.
2. The same penalty s hall b e incurred by the holder of public office who, taking advantage of his/her capacity and in violation of the allocation o f a legal transaction o f the S tate, o f a patrimonial nature, in favor o f o ne's o wn i nterests, o f a spouse, of agents of crime.

ARTICLE 365 (Illegal collection o f contributions)
1. T he official responsible for c ollecting taxes, fees o r o ther contributions who receives them, knowing t hat they are not due b y the taxpayer o r t hat they are due in a smaller amount, i s p unished with imprisonment of up t o 2 years or a fine of up to 240 days.
2. The same p enalty shall b e a pplied to the official who grants illegal discounts to the taxpayer.

ARTICLE 366 (Lack o f collaboration)
Any e mployee who, without legitimate r eason, fails to provide assistance t o a body o r employee of the Administration of Justice or any public service, after such assistance has been legally requested, requested or formally ordered b y a competent authority, shall b e punished w ith a prison s entence of up t o 2 years or a fine of up t o 2 40 days.

ARTICLE 367 (Violation o f home by employee)
Any e mployee who, abusing the powers inherent to his position or duties, commits the crime of rape or entering and remaining in another person's home shall b e subject to deprivation o f liberty, respectively, or administrative or disciplinary proceedings, the penalty i s imprisonment of up t o 3 y ears o r a fine of up t o 3 60 d ays.

ARTICLE 368 (Use o f public force against the execution o f law or legitimate order)
The e mployee who, being competent to request or execute a measure depriving liberty shall incur the penalty established in paragraph 3.

ARTICLE 369 (Torture and cruel, inhuman and d egrading t reatment)
1. A nyone w ho, having as their function the prevention, prosecution and investigation of offences of any nature, the investigation of the respective proceedings, the execution of legally applied criminal reactions or the protection, custody or surveillance of a person deprived of their liberty, commits acts of torture against that person or any other person or subjects them to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment in order to:
a) To punish for an act committed or allegedly committed by him or by a third party; b) To intimidate or intimidate a third party; c) To obtain testimony.
is punishable by imprisonment of 1 to 5 years.
2. If the facts described in the previous article cause serious harm to the physical or psychological integrity o f the victim and of the conduct results in a serious and incurable illness, suicide or death of the victim, the penalty is imprisonment of 5 to 12 years, and of 8 to 15 years, if the conduct results in death.

ARTICLE 370 (Aggravation)
The penalty is imprisonment of 5 to 12 years, if the conduct described in the previous article causes serious harm to the physical or psychological integrity of the victim and of 8 to 15 years, if the conduct results in a serious and incurable illness, suicide or death of the victim.

ARTICLE 371 (Civil servant)
1. For t he p urposes of t he Penal Code, the t erm e mployee includes:
a) The civil servant; b) The administrative agent; c) Holders o f political office, elected or appointed of the; d) Anyone who, even provisionally or temporarily, for remuneration or free of charge, has been called upon to perform or to practice or to participate in the performance of an activity included in the administrative or jurisdictional public function, or, in the same circumstances, performs functions in public utility bodies or participates in them, in particular members of the armed forces called upon to exercise civil functions of a public nature.
2. Public servants are considered equivalent to those who manage public companies.
3. All those who perform functions identical to those described in paragraph 1 within the scope of any public law organization of which Angola is a member are also considered equivalent to public servants.

ARTICLE 372 (Responsibility of the h ierarchical s uperior)
1. A superior who expressly or tacitly authorizes the practice, by his subordinate, of torture, cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment shall be punished with the penalty applicable to the perpetrator, increased by a quarter of its minimum and maximum limits.
2. A superior who, having become aware of the commission of the acts referred to in articles 370 and 371, fails to report them within a maximum period of 10 days shall be punished with a prison sentence of up to 3 years or a fine of up to 360 days.

ARTICLE 373 (Persecution o f innocents)
The official who, being in charge of investigation, instruction or procedural promotion activities, in criminal proceedings, pursues a person, knowing that he is innocent, that in relation to security measures or that it cannot be subjected to such persecution is punishable by imprisonment of 2 to 6 years.

ARTICLE 374 (Abuse of p ower)
Any employee who, outside of the cases provided for in the previous articles, abuses the powers inherent to the position or function he or she performs, with the intention of obtaining a benefit for himself or herself or for a third party or causing harm to another person, shall be punished with imprisonment of up to 3 years or a fine of up to 360 days.

ARTICLE 375 (Violation of confidentiality by employee)
1. An employee or person specifically obliged to provide a public service who, aware that he or she is endangering the public interest or that of a third party or with the intention of obtaining a benefit for himself or another person, reveals knowledge in the exercise of his/her position or function is punishable by imprisonment o f 1 to 5 years.
2. I n case o f n egligence, the p enalty is imprisonment of up t o 1 year or a fine o f up t o 120 days.
3. Criminal proceedings depend on the participation of the entity responsible for the service or a complaint from the offended party.

ARTICLE 376 (Civil servant)
For the purposes of the Penal Code, the term employee includes: a) The civil servant; b) The administrative agent; c) Holders of political office, elected or appointed; d) Anyone who, even provisionally or temporarily, for remuneration or free of charge, has been called upon to perform or to practice or to participate in the performance of an activity included in the administrative or jurisdictional public function...
TITLE VI Crimes Against Peace a nd the International Community

ARTICLE 377 (Incitement to hatred against a people and advocacy of w ar)
1. Whoever repeatedly and publicly incites hatred against a people, with the purpose of starting a war, is punished with a prison sentence of 1 to 8 years.
2. The same penalty shall be incurred by anyone who, in the same way, publicly incites discrimination, hatred and violence against a person or group of people, because of their race, color, ethnicity, place of birth, sex, sexual orientation, religion, political or ideological beliefs, social status or origin or any other forms of discrimination.
3. If any war breaks out, the penalty is imprisonment of 3 to 10 years.

ARTICLE 378 (Recruitment o f members of t he armed f orces)
Anyone who recruits members of the Angolan armed or security forces with the intention of waging war against a foreign state or territory or to forcibly overthrow the legitimate government of another state or territory shall be punished by imprisonment of 2 to 6 years.
2. Anyone who enlists in or joins the armed organization or group referred to in the previous number shall be punished with the same penalty.

ARTICLE 379 (Recruitment o f mercenaries)
1. W ho recruits mercenaries for an organization or military unit of a state, territory or part thereof, intending to trigger armed conflict or hostilities, shall be punished according to applicable international law.

ARTICLE 380 (Incitement t o discrimination)
1. Anyone who, in a meeting, public place or through any means of dissemination or communication with the public, incites hatred against a person or group of people because of their race, color, ethnicity, place of birth, sex, sexual orientation, illness, religion, political or ideological convictions, social condition or origin or other cause, with the purpose of discriminating against them, is punishable with imprisonment from 6 months to 6 years.
2. The same penalty applies to anyone who, in a public meeting or place or by any means of dissemination or communication with the public, incites acts of violence against a person or group of people because of their race, color, ethnicity, place of birth, sex, sexual orientation, illness.

ARTICLE 381 (Genocide)
1. Anyone who, as part of a concerted action and with the intention of partially exterminating or destroying a national, ethnic, racial or religious group: a) Willfully kill any member of the group, subject them to inhuman, cruel or degrading treatment and, in general, seriously offend their physical and mental integrity; b) Subject the group to living and existence conditions likely to cause its destruction, in whole or in part; c) Impose measures to prevent procreation and births within the group; d) Forcibly transfer minors under 18 years of age, belonging to the group, to any other group.
shall be punished with a prison sentence of 5 to 25 years.

ARTICLE 382 (Crimes against humanity)
Anyone who, in the context of a widespread or systematic attack against a given population or in the context of a military unit of a state, territory or part thereof, commits acts against protected persons including: a) Intentional homicide; b) Extermination; c) Slavery; d) Imprisonment or other form of severe deprivation of physical liberty, in violation of the norms and principles of international law; e) Violation of human dignity, in particular through the use of torture and other forms of cruel, inhuman and degrading behavior; f) Rape, sexual slavery, prostitution, pregnancy and sterilization; g) Persecution for political, ideological, racial, ethnic, social, cultural reasons or for reasons of nationality, gender, religion, illness or sexual orientation; h) Enforced disappearance; i) Subjecting one or more persons to physical mutilation or any type of medical experiment other than necessary for their health; j) Deportation or forced transfer of persons or groups of persons for reasons related to compelling military reasons.

ARTICLE 383 (Definitions for Article 382)
For the purposes of Article 382: a) “Attack” means any conduct involving the multiple commission of the acts described therein, in execution of a State or organisational policy aimed at such commission; b) “Extermination” means the extinction or elimination of persons or groups of persons as a result of the conditions to which they were intentionally subjected; c) “Slavery” means the exercise of a power resulting in a right of ownership or possession over a person or group of persons; d) “Forced deportation or transfer” means the displacement of persons by expulsion or other coercive means from the area in which they are found; e) “Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Acts” means acts causing acute or intense physical or psychological suffering; f) “Persecution” means the intentional deprivation of fundamental rights in violation of international law; g) “Enforced disappearance” means the detention, imprisonment or abduction of persons by a State or a political organization followed by the refusal to acknowledge deprivation of liberty.

ARTICLE 384 (Other crimes against humanity)
Anyone who commits an act of violence shall be punished with the penalty provided for in Article 382.

ARTICLE 385 (War crimes against civilians)
1. Anyone who, in violation of the rules of international law, commits acts during an international or military occupation of a State, territory or part thereof: a) Attack the civilian population; b) Taking hostages from among the civilian population; c) Recruit or permit minors under the age of 16 to be recruited and serve in the belligerent forces; d) Attack buildings, material, units and vehicles bearing the distinctive signs of the Geneva Conventions of 1949, in accordance with international law.

ARTICLE 386 (War crimes against objects other than military objectives)
The person who, under the conditions described in Article 385, attacks by any means population centers, dwellings or undefended buildings and, in general, civilian objects or targets, causing their total or partial destruction whenever such civilian objects or targets do not constitute military combat objectives, shall be punished with a prison sentence of 3 to 12 years.

ARTICLE 387 (War crimes against combat personnel)
The person who, in the context described in paragraph 1 of article 385, commits against persons protected by international law: a) Compelling a prisoner of war or of a belligerent force to serve in the armed forces of a hostile power; b) Depriving a prisoner of war or of a belligerent force or other person protected by international law of the right to a fair and impartial trial; c) Sentencing and executing, without prior trial by a regularly constituted court offering the generally recognized indispensable judicial guarantees, a prisoner of war or a person protected by international law; d) Killing or wounding a combatant who has laid down his arms or has unconditionally surrendered.

ARTICLE 388 (Other war crimes)
1. He shall be punished with imprisonment from 3 to 20 years, if a more severe penalty is not applicable under another provision.
2. The following shall be punished with the same penalty: a) Atomic or radioactive weapons; b) Poison or poisoned weapons; c) Weapons, projectiles, materials and methods of warfare likely to cause death, illness or serious harm to the physical integrity of an undetermined number of people; d) Weapons, projectiles, materials and methods of warfare likely to cause extensive, serious and lasting damage to the natural environment and endanger the health or survival of populations.

ARTICLE 389 (Other crimes)
Anyone who commits any crime contrary to international treaties or conventions signed by Angola and received in the Angolan legal system shall be punished according to applicable law.

ARTICLE 390 (Definitions)
For the purposes of the provisions of this title, the following shall be considered:
a) “Considerably High Value”, which exceeds 500 times the monthly minimum wage of public office, at the time the act is committed; b) “High Value”, which exceeds 100 times the lowest monthly salary in the public service, at the time the act is committed; c) “Diminutive Value”, which does not exceed half of the lowest monthly salary in the public service, at the time the act is committed; d) “Burglary”, the breaking, fracturing or destruction, in whole or in part, of any device intended to close or prevent entry, from outside or inside the house or dependent enclosed place; e) “Climbing”, entry into a house or enclosed space dependent thereon, through a place not, in principle, intended for entry, in particular through ceilings, balconies, windows, walls, underground openings or through any device intended to close or prevent entry or passage; f) “False Keys”: i. Imitated, counterfeited or altered; ii. The real ones, when they are beyond the power of those who have the right to use them; g) “Landmark” means a ny construction, plantation, fence, sign or other sign intended to establish the boundaries of properties or concessions; h) “Gang or Quadrilha”, the group formed by two or more people for the repeated practice of theft.

CHAPTER II Crimes Against P roperty SECTION I Theft C rimes ARTICLE 392 (Theft)
Whoever, with the intention of appropriating for himself or for another, another person's movable or movable property, steals it is punished with penalties of: a) Imprisonment of up to 3 years or a fine of up to 360 days, if the value of the stolen item is not high; b) Imprisonment of 1 to 5 years, if the value of the stolen item is high; c) Imprisonment of 2 to 8 years, if the value of the stolen item is considerably high.
ARTICLE 393 (Aggravation)
1. The penalties established in the previous article are aggravated whenever the stolen movable property: a) It is deposited or kept in the custody of museums or collected in any of their collection or public exhibition or accessible to the public, if it is deposited or kept in the custody of museums or collected in any of their enclosed place dependent thereon; b) It is used for religious worship or intended to venerate the memory of the deceased and the theft occurs in a place intended for worship or in a cemetery; c) If it is intended for public service, is assigned to the distribution network or provision of public goods or services or constitutes a product of primary necessity and the removal disrupts the operation of the service, causes interruption or interference in the supply to the public or in the provision of the service by the State or authorized entities; d) It is removed from a place intended for the storage of goods or objects or removed from any means of transport and the removal occurs between the time of loading and the time of arrival at the destination or delivery; e) If it is locked in a drawer, safe or similar object equipped with a lock, combination or other device specifically designed for security; f) Possess, by its nature, high dangerousness.
2. The penalties established in the previous article are also aggravated whenever the agent: a) To commit the act, enter a dwelling, even if it is mobile, a commercial or industrial establishment or a closed space, public or private, by means of breaking and entering, climbing or using false keys; b) He is a member of a gang or group and the theft is committed with the collaboration of at least one other member of the gang or group; c) Taking advantage of the particular physical or psychological vulnerability of the victim or of occasions of fire, explosion, flood, shipwreck, earthquake, riot and, in general, of circumstances favourable to the commission of theft caused by any disaster, accident or other situations involving public disturbance and commotion; d) Illegally enter a property or movable dwelling, commercial or industrial establishment or any closed space, public or private, or remain hidden there for the purpose of committing theft; e) Committing the act by usurping the title, uniform or insignia of a public employee, civil or military, alleging a false order of public authority; f) In the case of cattle theft, if it enters the corrals of rural areas or is carried out in a place in the wilderness; g) Make the practice of theft a way of life.

ARTICLE 394 (Theft o f c ommon things)
1. Whoever, being a joint owner or co-owner, co-possessor, co-heir or partner of a common movable property, steals it shall be punished with the penalties provided for in Article 392, reduced by half at their maximum limit.
2. The subtraction of a fungible common thing is not punishable if the value subtracted does not exceed the share belonging to the agent.

ARTICLE 395 (Theft o f vehicle use)
1. Whoever, without the authorization of the respective owner, steals a car or other motor vehicle, boat or aircraft, to use them temporarily and then return them, is punished with a prison sentence of 6 months to 2 years or a fine of 60 to 240 days.
2. The penalty is imprisonment of 1 to 3 years or a fine of 120 to 360 days if the vehicle stolen for use is used for public purposes, for the provision of a public service or specifically intended for rescue missions, patrol, transportation of protocol figures or institutional support.
